description: 3D Monster Maze was one of the first computer games to use a first-person 3D perspective. After being introduced to the game by a circus crier, the player character is transferred to a randomly generated 16x16 maze and has to find the exit. There is but one difficulty: There is a Tyrannosaurus Rex hidden in the maze. As soon as the protagonist moves, the dinosaur will begin to chase him, getting more and more active the nearer he gets. The T. Rex's state is indicated in the status bar, letting the player know if he is still far away ("Rex lies in wait"), if he's approaching ("Footsteps approaching") or if the player should really get a move on ("RUN! He is behind you"). The protagonist can run quicker than the dino, but many are the adventurers that took a wrong turn or came to a dead end. The exit, of course, lies at such a dead end and is only visible from a few steps distance.
title: 3D Monster Maze

description:
Lunar Rescue is a clone of Taito's arcade game of the same name. The aim of the game is to evacuate humanoids from the surface of a moon. From a mothership at the top of the screen, the player drops down lunar modules that he has to safely land on the moon's three landing platforms. This works similar to Lunar Lander but here the player has to navigate his way through an asteroid storm. The player can steer left and right and use the thrust to hover in the air. Once the player has landed successfully the humanoids will enter the module and the player takes off again. But now the scenario has changed. Above him he will find waves of aliens that drop bombs. To survive the player has to dodge the alien ships and make it back to the mothership. Now thrust isn't available any more. Instead the player can use a gun to shoot at the aliens.

There are six groups of humanoids. The player gets points for each successful landing and each alien shot down. When the last humanoid has been rescued the player gets bonus points for every one he has managed to bring back. Bonus points are also awarded based on the amount of fuel that remains. For each group that has been rescued the game goes on with increased difficulty and bonuses.

sample_screenshots.caption: Made it to the landing platform
Aliens arrive as I take off

title: Lunar Rescue

description: Centipede is an early attempt to bring Atari's arcade game with the same name to a home computer. The player controls a laser base at the bottom of the screen and has to shoot at the centipede-like aliens that appear at the top of the screen and then crawls towards him. Unlike the Atari game the player can only move left and right and not up and down. Neither does it feature any mushrooms. Instead there are only a few obstacles that stop the centipedes and make them change direction. When a centipede is shot it splits into two halves. The player must shoot all segments before they reach the baseline. If they do the player loses a base. The number of bases is user defined (1 to 5) and so is the movement speed of the centipedes. Another feature not present in the arcade game is that the centipedes can drop bombs at the player.

sample_screenshots.caption: Only small parts of it remains here

title: Centipede

description: Galactic Gunner is a shooting game where the player has to shoot down as many ships from an enemy space fleet as possible. The game is viewed from a first person perspective and it involves moving around a crosshair and then pressing the fire button when an enemy ship flies past it. The firing is not instant so the player has to anticipate the enemy's position. Space is full of dust clouds that the player's shots won't penetrate and when the enemy ship hides beneath them they have to wait it out. One enemy appears on screen at a time and when killed another will take its place. The game goes on till either the time runs out or the player has used all the 25 shots they have at their disposal. The player can choose between five skill levels and the scoring is dependent on this. Higher skill levels mean faster enemies and less time available. For each enemy shot down the player earns 10 times the skill level.

sample_screenshots.caption: Can't hit the enemy when he hides beneath a cloud

title: Galactic Gunner

description:
In Galaxy Jailbreak the player takes control of some kind of man of law who has just captured some evil alien generals and had them locked up in jail. But now a rescuing attempt is under way. A group of alien soldiers try to evacuate their masters by hyperspacing into the scene and breaking down the walls of the jail. It's of course up to the player to stop them and defend the jail.

The game is a fixed screen shoot 'em up. The player controls a stellar missile base at the bottom of the screen and above him is the jail. Similar to other early shooters like Space Invaders the player can move left and right and shoot up against the enemies. The enemies teleport into the screen one at a time and they then bounce around the screen as if they were balls from Breakout. As they hit the jail they will remove one piece of its walls at a time until the holes are big enough for the generals to escape. The player scores for each enemy he hits; 20 points for soldiers and 50 points for generals. When generals are hit they turn into three soldiers. The player also has to watch out for the bombs that the generals drop.
title: Galaxy Jailbreak

description: 1K ZX Chess is a single-player chess game. Certain rules are omitted (castling, en passant capture, pawn promotion), as the code fits under one kilobyte (hence the title). The computer plays White with either of the two opening moves included.
title: 1K ZX Chess

description: ZX Chess II is an improved version of ZX Chess I, a single-player chess game. In addition to the features of the previous version (custom board setup, printing etc.), the code enhancements include additional difficulty level, faster move calculation and an option for the player to ask the program to suggest a move.
title: ZX Chess II

description:
Pilot is a flight simulator of a light civilian aircraft flying at night on instruments only (IFR). It presents the player with 5 set-ups (and a demo mode), either to take-off, land, or navigate between beacons, against the wind and mountainous terrain.

Due to limitations of early 1980s computers it doesn't offer external cockpit view, only an instrument panel with a set of gauges: altimeter, tachometer, artificial horizon, compass, airspeed and vertical speed indicator, distance measuring equipment (DME), fuel gauge. The plane is also equipped with flaps, retractable landing gear, ILS and ADF.
title: Pilot

description:
Curso de Jogos em Basic TK is a book with a course on games for the TK line of computers, ZX-81 clones released by Microdigital in Brazil. The course has some simple games included as examples. These games are:

  • Tiro ao Alvo: the player inputs an angle and a speed trying to hit a target;
  • Salvamento (or Suicídio): two players controls a litter trying to save a man jumping from a building. The player enters the speed the litter should move, based on which floor the man is and where the litter is;
  • Cassino (or Caça Níqueis): a slot-machine simulator;
  • Sub-Hunter: the player controls an helicopter trying to bomb a submarine which becomes visible (by raising its periscope) for just a few moments;
  • Jockey: a horse race gambling game;
  • Órbita: the player controls a ship orbiting a star and has to dock it to a fueling ship before the fuel runs out;
  • Come Número: the player has to "eat" numbers that appear on screen.
  • Forca: a hangman game.
  • Tank: a tank battle game.
title: Curso de Jogos em Basic TK

description: Invaders is a Space Invaders clone: In the game the player controls a gun which can move left and right to hide behind bunkers, then shoot at the advancing ranks of aliens; watch for their mothership. The game includes ten difficulty levels and the player starts with three lives.
title: Invaders

description: Another Space Invaders clone: move your gun left/right to hide behind shields, then shoot at the advancing ranks of aliens. Three speed settings (also when you beat a wave the speed of the next increases), player starts with three lives.
title: Space Invaders

description: Namtir Raiders is a fixed screen shoot 'em up. The objective is simply to shoot down as many enemy raiders as possible and save the earth. There are four waves of enemies and each wave has a different kind of enemy. The movement of the ship is a bit different from other shoot 'em ups. Rather than having keys for up, down, left and right, they here lead to diagonal moves (for example up and left, down and right). The player has five lives and earns more when all four waves have been completed. Once they have the game starts over with the first wave. A difficulty level between one and three can be chosen before the game begins. The higher levels run at a higher pace.
title: Namtir Raiders

description: Bank Robber is a variant of Commodore's Money Wars. The player controls a man who has to move money from the bank to his home. The bank is located on the left side of the screen while the home is located on the right side. The buildings can however only be entered when their doors are opened. From the sky, meteorites are falling and the player has to avoid being hit by these while moving across the screen. Getting hit means a life is lost. Other things falling from the sky are pills that give an extra life when eaten and bricks that when caught builds or repairs one of three protection buildings (similar to the shields in Space Invaders). At the end of the game the player gets a ranking depending on the amount of cash that has been collected.

sample_screenshots.caption: Once the money has been collected, the player character changes from A to £

title: Bank Robber

description: U.F.O. is a fixed screen shoot 'em up that is based on the arcade game Astro Invader. Rampaging hordes of kamikaze aliens are attacking the earth and of course it's up to the player to shoot them down before they crash into the surface. What sets Astro Invaders variants apart from other shoot 'em ups is that the aliens position themselves in columns after entering the screen. As the columns fill up with aliens, they begin to descend until they explode upon hitting the ground. If in range of the explosion, the player will die. In addition to these normal aliens, there are neutron bombers whose explosion range covers the full screen and therefore has to be shot down. The player has three lives.
title: U.F.O.

description:
Twenty years after the extremists have unleashed their weapon of mass destruction, the life on Venus is returning to a normal state. The Galactic Trading Corporation is investing millions to restore its economy.

Merchant of Venus is a sci-fi space trading game. The player starts with 500,000 cash on hand (awarded by GTC) to buy a freighter and start their own business. Trading involves navigating between spaceports to exploit price variations, with manual landings (Lunar Lander style). Players can buy or sell ten different commodities (robots, raw materials, obligatory spice, etc.) and must keep their ship repaired and well-fueled.
title: Merchant of Venus

description:
3D 3D! is a maze game where the player simply has to find his or her way out of the maze. The game is played from a first person perspective and the maze is three dimensional meaning it's designed as a cube with multiple levels. The player starts at the lowest level and has to get to the exit at level 10. A map can be used to show the player's position in the level and it's also possible to show the locations of shafts to the upper levels. A score is calculated based on how many steps the player takes and adds penalties for reading the map.

The game uses absolute orientation and the player looks around by pressing six direction keys. Pressing enter moves the player one step forward and for every action made the screen is redrawn. The game has both fast and slow modes and it is possible to turn on shaded walls for enhanced, but slower to draw, graphics.

sample_screenshots.caption: Waiting for the maze to be built
Shaded walls makes a very slow game even slower

title: 3D 3D!

description:
Bat Cage is an action game where the player has to capture bats while fighting off other bats that try to rescue them. The playing field consists of a bat cage in the bottom and above it a bat flap around and there are also eight bat eggs bouncing around. The player controls a bar that can be moved around freely. It is used to capture the bat eggs which are taken to the bat cage where they can hatch. As soon as the hatching begins the bat at the top of the screen will attack and try to rescue the egg. The player then has to use the bar to fend it off. It works a bit similar to Breakout as the bat will bounce back up again when it makes contact with the bar. The player then scores points as long as the egg hatches. Ultimately the attacking bat will give up and retreat and the player can move on to the next egg that needs to be captured.

As the game goes on the player will reach bonus levels and the number of attacking bats will increase. The game is over when the bats stay at the top of the screen and no longer attack when the player hatches his eggs. The game can be set to different skill levels (1-36) that alters the speed of the game.
title: Bat Cage

description:
Rocket Man is a platformer where the player has to collect diamonds. The diamonds are located on the far left side of the screen and the player starts out to the right. The right side consists of platforms and ladders but to get to the diamonds the player will need a jetpack to fly across the gap that separates them from the rest of the screen. To use the jetpack the player first has to collect fuel cans which appear in random positions. Once the gauge indicates there is enough fuel in the tank the player can pick up the jetpack and go get the diamonds. When the fuel runs out the player has to go back and collect more fuel. Beneath the platforms are water that the player has to avoid. There is also a bubble that moves around the screen trying to catch the player. When it succeeds it drags the player down into the water. Contact with water leads to a lost life.

The game consist of six levels each with a different platform layout. On the first three levels the bubble gets increasingly better at homing in on the player, making the game harder. On levels 4 to 6 the jetpack is replaced by a vulture and instead of collecting fuel the player has to collect lamb legs to feed the vulture.
title: Rocket Man

description: One Little Ghost is a Pac-Man variant. It uses a scrolling isometric view making it similar to Pac-Mania in appearance. The concept of the original game is turned on its head as here the player controls a ghost who is chased by pac-men. The gameplay works the same though as the player has to collect all the dots in the maze while avoiding the pac-men. There is one difference though. Ghosts obviously doesn't have lives, instead the player has a spirit meter. Spirit decrease when the player makes contact with the enemies. This means there's no instant deaths but the game is over when all spirit is gone.
title: One Little Ghost

description:
Catacombs is a dungeon crawler where the player has to find his or her way through randomly generated dungeons while collecting as much gold as he or she can. Little of the dungeon is shown when starting so the player has to explore to find the exit and move on to the next level in the dungeon. Sometimes it's necessary to dig tunnels through walls to move forward.

The player only has one statistic, strength, and it constantly decreases. When it reaches zero the player dies and has to start over in a new dungeon. To increase the strength the player has to collect food. The dungeons are full of monsters that the player can engage in combat. Battles are automatic and the only option available for the player is to run away. The outcome of battles depend on strength as it decreases for each hit. Winning a battle leads to an increase in strength. There are also traps to watch out for. When stepping on one, the player has five chances to guess a number and if he or she succeeds, they will be saved. The player can also come across phantoms which can be paid to increase strength.
title: Catacombs

description: Quack! is a clone of the mobile game Flappy Bird for the ZX81 computer. The gameplay is the same as in the original. The player controls a bird which has to be navigated through the gaps of an endless amount of pipes. The bird automatically moves forward and all the player has to do is tapping a key (any will do) to increase the altitude of the bird. Not tapping causes the bird to fall. The player scores for each pair of pipes the bird passes and the game ends when it crashes into a pipe or into the ground.

sample_screenshots.caption: Passing some pipes (well, trying at least)

title: Quack!

description: Cosmic Guerilla is an unofficial conversion of Universal's arcade game with the same name. The basic gameplay is mostly the same although the scenario differs a bit. Here, the cosmic guerillas are raiding a city in space which the player has to defend. At their disposal, the player has their Svlegian Raider which is moved across the bottom of the screen while shooting at the enemies above. The enemies begin at the sides of the screen and move towards the centre where supply pods are located. The pods are protected by barriers that the aliens will remove one piece at a time. Once they have made a hole through they can take the pods and transport them back to the edge of the screen. The player has to prevent them from doing this by shooting them down in time, at the same time watching out for their fire. Some protection is offered by four Space Invaders-esque shields. The player has three lives and loses one when shot or when the aliens recover a pod. Before a game, one of three game speeds can be chosen.
title: Cosmic Guerilla

description: Booster is a follow up to Rocket Man. Like that game it is a platformer where the player uses a jetpack to fly between platforms. The objective of the game is to collect fuel cells that appear at random positions on the right side of the screen. These then have to be transported back to the player's flying saucer which is located on the left side. In the way there are plenty of hazards and bad guys that the player has to avoid. These include spiders, skulls, pests and nettles. The player also can't take too long as he has a limited supply of air. Another way of dying is crashing into a platform with the jetpack. The game has five levels that can be played in any order.
title: Booster

description: ZX-Galaxians is as can be expected a variant of the arcade game Galaxian. It's a fixed screen shooter where the player move their spacecraft down the bottom of the screen and has to shoot at the aliens moving back and forth above them. Aliens will at times leave their formation and swoop down towards the player try to collide with them or hit them with bombs. Aliens in formation are worth ten points while attacking aliens are worth twenty. When all three lives have been lost, the game ends and the player gets to enter his or her name for a high score.
title: ZX-Galaxians

description:
Dungeon of Ymir is a dungeon crawling RPG where the player has to find the sacred Sword of Kaslo. The dungeon consists of multiple levels connected with stairs that the player has to explore. There are plenty of monsters that will come in the hero's path and the combat with these is automatically performed when contact is made. Once the battle has started it can not be cancelled. If healing potions are available they will be automatically used in combat when needed. Hit points lost will automatically recharge after battle. Defeating a monster leads to an increase in experience points and ultimately the player will level up. Some of the monsters that the player will encounter are minotaurs, archers, birdmen, dire wolves, three-legged gremlins and ghastly ghouls.

Various objects can be found around the corridors of the dungeon. This includes gold, spell vials, lamps and mysterious chests. There are also temples that the player can visit. A few different kinds of spell can be cast: drift, shield, teleport and invoke rejuvenation. The player can also use healing potions. Sometimes the player might stumble upon an oracle who might help the player.

sample_screenshots.caption: Encounter with a ghastly gory ghoul

title: Dungeon of Ymir

description:
Supermaze is a maze game played from a first person perspective. It features ten different mazes and the objective of all of them is to move from the entrance on the left to the exit on the right. The player loses if they exit through the entrance or if they walk into a wall. The game is played with three keys: f (move forward), r (turn right) and l (turn left). The mazes differ in size and minimum number of moves required. The smallest is 5x5 while the largest is 10x10.

Before starting a game, the player can choose to turn on four options. These are stones to drop (that can be used to track the player's position), a compass, a trap door that the player can fall through and gold bars that can collected. In addition to the ten mazes that are included, it's also possible for the player to create their own mazes.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is how the data behind the mazes look like

title: Supermaze

description:
Z-Xtricator is a side-scrolling shooter. It is inspired by Defender but only scrolls from left to right at a steady pace, with no option to turn around and move in the opposite direction. It takes place long ago in a galaxy far away where a war between two hostile races took place. Prisoners taken could not expect to survive for long and their only hope lay with the Xtricators, a group of warriors whose job it was to rescue people from the enemy's home planet.

The player takes control of a member of the Xtricators called Zed and has to collect all members of his group that have been captured. To pick up a prisoner the player has to move down close to the surface without hitting the ground. Due to the planet's gravitational pull the player can't stay close to the surface too long since the ship will then explode. At the same time the player has to fight the enemy fighters that try to stop him. Two weapons are available: a regular laser cannon and a super zapper bomb that destroys all enemies on the screen. The bombs have to be used sparingly as there are only three in supply. Occasionally a mother ship will appear which must be hit four times with the laser. The player has a limited amount of fuel but after rescuing all prisoners the player returns home for a refill before the game continues with another tougher stage.

sample_screenshots.caption: Using a bomb causes the screen to flash, something that's hard to depict with a screenshot
Danger warning appears when getting too close to the surface
Here's a prisoner I have to pick up

title: Z-Xtricator

description: Boulder Logic is a variant of Boulder Dash where the hero, Bradford Walker-Smythe, is out looking for the perfect engagement ring for his girlfriend Tania. Therefore he sets off to the mines of Cornwall where he searches for that perfect diamond. The goal for each of the game's 32 levels is to unlock the exit by collecting a certain number of diamonds. At the same time Bradford has to avoid the boulders that will fall down on him if he digs a path under them. There are also various roaming creatures that have to be avoided. Theses monsters can be killed with falling boulders and sometimes diamonds will take their place. In some levels the player has to collect keys to be able to reach diamonds that have been locked away. There is also a time limit to mind.

sample_screenshots.caption: Kill a baddy and you might get lots of diamonds

title: Boulder Logic

description: Jim Bagley's ZX81 Racing is a racing game viewed from a top down perspective featuring single screen race tracks similar to those in Super Sprint. Controls are simple with buttons for steering left and right as well as accelerating and braking. There are two game modes: survival and speed race. In the survival mode the car automatically moves forward at a steady pace (starting at 160 mph) and the player has to avoid crashing by steering left and right. For each lap survived the speed increases by 4 mph. In the speed game the player races against the clock and has to complete ten laps in the best possible time. When crashing the speed drops to zero and the player has to start accelerating again. The game has eight different race tracks.
title: Jim Bagley's ZX81 Racing

description: Alien-Dropout is a shoot 'em up based on the arcade game Astro Invader. Earth is once again threatened by aliens and it's up to the player to stop them. The aliens are launched onto the screen from a mothership that moves across the upper part of the screen. Beneath it are columns which the aliens enter before they attack the player. When hitting the ground the aliens explode and the player has to stay out of their blast radius. In addition to the regular aliens there is also a larger kind that appears in the middle of the screen. When this one hits the ground its blast radius covers the whole ground and therefore it has to be shot down. The game is over when all three lives have been lost. Before starting a game the player can change the skill level by altering the speed of the player, aliens and the mothership.

sample_screenshots.caption: Mothership drop aliens into the columns
The blast radius of the larger aliens cover the whole screen
A larger advance down the middle

title: Alien-Dropout

description: Ferengi is an arcade game set in space loosely based on the Star Trek franchise, a continuation of the ZX81 game Klingons. A Klingon ship full of gold-pressed Latinum crashed in an asteroid field. The goal of the player is to collect as many Latinum bars as possible by avoiding the deadly asteroids flying around. The ship constantly moves at a constant speed downwards. The player can only move the spaceship left and right.
title: Ferengi

description: Gobblers is a Pac-Man clone for up to four players. The gameplay stays the same as the original with the player navigating a grey square through a maze while eating as many pills as he possibly can. At the same time he has to watch out for the meanies (black squares with eyes) that chase him. By collecting power pills the meanies become edible but only for a short time. The player has three lives and earns another one after scoring 10,000 points. Pills are worth ten points each and for every meanie eaten the points double with first one being worth 200. After all players have lost their lives a high score list shows who has done the best.

sample_screenshots.caption: Eating power pills make meanies edible

title: Gobblers

description: Alien is a game inspired by the movie with the same name but without a license. The game takes place aboard the transport ship Nostrodamus and the player's objective is simply to destroy the alien. The game is viewed from a top down perspective where the whole ship is visible. The player character and the alien are represented by flashing squares although the alien is only visible when within ten moves from the player. The player can also see various letters that represent weapons although the player won't know which weapon is which before picking them up. To attack the alien the player has to pick up a weapon and then use it in the direction of the alien. The player can only carry one weapon at a time and won't know what effect it has until he has tried it out on the alien. Once the action has taken place the weapon is automatically dropped and another weapon has to be picked up and used to further damage the alien. The player has four crew members and when they have all died the game is over.
title: Alien

description:
Fortress of Zorlac is a shoot 'em up with some similarities to Yars' Revenge. The player's objective is to rid the galaxy of a dreaded alien called Zorlac. Zorlac is positioned on the right side of the screen and is protected by a fortress consisting of three rotating walls as well as four indestructible stationary guns. The player starts out at the left edge of the screen but can move around in all directions. To be able to hit the alien the player first has to blast a hole through the three walls. It is made harder by the constant movements of both the rotating walls and the alien. At the same time the player has to avoid being hit by the defense guns which automatically lock in on the player ship. As the game goes on the fortress slowly moves toward the player who gets less space to dodge the enemy fire.

Once the player has been able to hit Zorloc, he gets enraged and the game moves on to the next level that's played at a higher speed. The player scores points by destroying the walls of the fortress and for hitting the alien. Points are awarded based on the skill level chosen before a game and the player's distance from the edge of the screen. Hitting the alien is worth fifty times more than destroying a block in the fortress. The player has access to five ships and once they have all been destroyed the game ends.

sample_screenshots.caption: The closer to the fortress you are the more points you will score

title: Fortress of Zorlac

description: Kongs Revenge is a Donkey Kong variant. Like in the original arcade game the player has to save a maiden from a vicious monkey. To reach the maiden at the top of the screen the player has to climb ladders and jump between platforms. A ladder is automatically climbed when the player walks into it and it is not possible to go back down (although some levels have lifts for going down). To avoid climbing a ladder the player has to jump past it and then the ladder is destroyed. The player has to watch out for barrels that are dropped by Kong as well as fireballs. Barrels can be jumped past while fire balls cannot be avoided. Ladders are destroyed when hit by a fireball which might make a level unfinishable. The player has five lives and is given a score when all are lost. After a game is over it's possible to restart from the current level without going back to the first.
title: Kongs Revenge

description: Geographics UK is an educational quiz game. The player is presented with a map of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland and has to answer questions concerning various locations including cities, rivers, islands, mountains and straits. There are three types of questions: those where the player has to move a circle to the right location on the map, those where a location is marked on the map and the player has to choose the right name from a list and those where the player is given the name and has to choose one of the locations marked on the map. Depending on how close the player is or how many attempts are needed, up to three points are scored. A round consists of ten questions and the maximum score therefore is thirty. At the end of the round the player is given a mark.

sample_screenshots.caption: Move the circle to the right location

title: Geographics UK

description:
This cassette consists of two games: Alien Rain on side A and Outrider on side B.

Alien Rain is a variant of Money Wars. The player has to rescue stranded life forms while watching out for aliens falling from the sky. The life forms are located at the right side of the screen and the player has to move from the left, across the screen, pick up the life form and then return to the starting position. Three Space Invaders-style shields offer some protection but are quickly destroyed.

Outrider is a shoot 'em up game controlled with only one button. The player controls a fighter ship circling a mothership that needs to be protected from various aliens. As the player ship moves around the mothership it constantly rotates and by pressing the fire button the aim is locked and shooting begins. There are four different kinds of aliens worth different amount of points. The game goes on until the mothership is completely destroyed.

sample_screenshots.caption: The mothership is almost completely destroyed (Outrider)

title: Alien Rain & Outrider

description: Em Busca dos Tesouros (commonly referred to as Treasure Hunter in English) is a platformer similar to Pitfall!. Like in that game the player has to collect large amount of treasures. There are different kinds of treasure including silver and gold coins, jewelry, medallions and precious arks. The game features 313 screens and 15 different enemies including scorpions, snakes, alligators and numerous other dangerous creatures. There are also hazards such as giant rolling boulders and collapsing structures. Getting touched by any enemy, hazard or falling from a height results in a lost life. The player has nine lives in total. Like in Pitfall! there are ropes that can be used to swing across large gaps. The player earns points by collecting treasure and by passing screens.
title: Em Busca dos Tesouros

description:
Wrath of Kong is a Donkey Kong variant. A girl called Jane has been captured by Kong and it's up to the player to go into his lair and rescue her. By climbing ladders and jumping between platforms the player has to make his way to the top of the screen where Jane is located. At the same time it's necessary to avoid the barrels that Kong throws toward the player.

The game has four levels. In the first one the player can use a hammer to smash barrels, in the second one there are trap doors to watch out for, in the third one there are walls and open spaces to jump over and across and in the final level there are collapsing girders to be wary of. The player scores points for jumping over and smashing barrels as well as rescuing Jane.
title: Wrath of Kong

description: This version of Tetris for the ZX81 plays just like the original game. Blocks are dropped from the top of the screen and the player's job is to piece these together into complete rows that then disappear. The player can move the pieces left, right and down and rotate them both clockwise and anticlockwise. As more and more rows are removed the game's level goes up leading to an increase of pace. For each row removed the player earns points and the game goes on until pieces reach the top of the screen.
title: Tetris

description:
ZX Puyo is a variant of the falling block puzzle game Puyo Puyo. Blocks consisting of two tiles fall from the top of the screen and the player has to arrange these so that clusters of four or more tiles of the same sort are created. Once a cluster of tiles has been created it is removed and other tiles fall down in its place. By removing tiles from the board the player scores points and prevents the tiles from reaching the top which means game over. Sometimes garbage blocks fall onto the board and to remove them the player has to create clusters that are adjacent to them.

Since the ZX81 doesn't support colour, the tiles are differed by symbols like asterisks, circles and dollar signs. When clusters begin to be created the tiles change from white to black. Three different difficulties can be chosen before starting a game. Unlike most games in the Puyo Puyo series, this version is for one player only, with no competitive mode.

sample_screenshots.caption: Garbage blocks has to be cleared with adjacent matches
Tiles turn to black when clusters begin to form

title: ZX Puyo

description: Zac-Man is a Pac-Man clone and has you controlling Zac-Man around a maze to attempt to eat all the dots to complete the maze. As you move around and eat the dots, there are ghosts moving around and trying to catch you - if they do then you lose one of three lives. Power-Pills can be collected, and these allow you to eat the ghosts for a limited time. Before the game you can choose the speed of the game (1-9) - with 1 being the fastest.

sample_screenshots.caption: Your chance to eat the ghosts.

title: Zac-Man

description: Walk the Plank is a word game based on the classic game of Hangman, but instead of stopping yourself from being hanged, you must stop Pirate Pete walking the plank. Before you start you have the choice of guessing a six or eight letter word. The actual game sees Pirate Pete from the side at the start of the plank and you have to type in a letter from the alphabet. If it is right then it appears as part of the word, but get it wrong and you move closer to the edge of the plank. You can only guess six letters wrong and if you do then you fall of the plank and into the sea. Get the word right and you move onto the next word.
title: Walk the Plank

alternate_titles.title: What Happened in the World Cup?

description: Test Your Knowledge of World Cup Football is a quiz game between one to four players on the FIFA World Cup. There are five topics to choose from and they are The Winners, The Runners-Up, Teams in the Final, The Scorers and Pot Pourri. There are 20 questions for each topic and each player chooses a number to receive their multiple choice question with six answers. Each player takes it in turn to answer a question and the winner is the player with the most correct answers.
title: Test Your Knowledge of World Cup Football

description: Traffic is a flick-screen game where you have to move across lanes full of various vehicles for as many points as you can. The vehicles move left or right across the screen and you have to move upwards through gaps while avoiding getting hit by the vehicles or it is game over. If you move downwards then your score decreases. There are 3 skill levels and you can choose the speed of the game (1-255) with 1 being the fastest.

sample_screenshots.caption: You were hit by a vehicle.

title: Traffic

description: Tempest is a shooter where your craft moves up or down the left side of the screen while a variety of aliens moves from the right side towards you. The aim is to avoid or shoot the waves of aliens called sectors which can last from 23 to 40 seconds. If you are touched by an alien or it's lasers then you lose one of five lives. Once you have survived a sector then you move towards the right of the screen attempting to avoid the spikes to move onto the next. There are variety of aliens that move in different ways with some firing back at you and others indestructible. There are five skill levels (1-5) with 1 being the hardest and the easier the skill level the longer a sector lasts. A joystick or keyboard is used to control your craft.
title: Tempest

description: 3D Formule 1 is a racing game played from a first person perspective where the player gets to race in the Le Mans 24 Hours. Up to four players can compete in hot seat and the aim is to get as far as possible. Each player gets three chances before it's game over. There are two difficulties that the player has to overcome. First the player has to keep the car on the road and not crash. Second the player has to race at the correct average speed. There is a minimum speed that is checked every ten minutes (in-game time, not real time) and if the player is below it the car will be stopped by the computer. The minimum speed is initially 216 km/h and increases with 36 km/h for every test. Before starting the race there is a 30 second long demonstration mode that lets the player examine the race track beforehand.

sample_screenshots.caption: Avoid hitting those posts is probably a good idea

title: 3D Formule 1

description:
During and after a christmas party at Macrobiology Industries Limited horrible thing happens in the laboratory's containment fridge as large quantities of swine-flu vaccine gets mixed with cucumber sandwiches and the boss' viagra supply. At the year's first day of work the company's security guard enters the site, finds the containment fridge smashed and realises that things aren't quite right. As the building now is full of virus spores, the security guards grabs his gun and gets ready for some shooting.

Virus is an action game where the player controls his character from a top down perspective. It is inspired by Into The Eagles Nest. The player can move in all four directions and use his gun to kill the viruses that he comes across. To progress he has to pick up keys that are needed to open some doors while other doors can be shot open. Other collectibles that will be needed are ammo and health packs. The objective of each of the eight levels is to kill all the viruses and get to the exit. Health is decreasing continuously with time so if all health packs have been collected it's necessary to hurry to the exit or the player will die. In case the player runs out of ammo it's possible to restart a level but that leads to the score being reduced.
title: Virus

description:
10 Games is a collection of games and programs on one tape. The collection contains:

Klingons: You are a spaceship returning from a mining expedition and you have run into a Battlefleet of Klingons but you have no guns so with your shield you must ram them all. The game is viewed from above with you scrolling down the screen and the Klingons scrolling upwards. You receive extra points for any Battleships or Motherships that you hit.

Crash-Landing: Your spaceship has been hit by a meteor and you are prepared for a crash landing on a planet with the only control you have is using your rockets. The game is text only and you see your fuel levels, velocity, height and the time.

Simon: Based on the classic game where the computer shows you a sequence of colours and you have to input the same sequence. Every time you get the sequence correct, the computer adds another colour to the same sequence.

Artist: A drawing program that allows you to draw pictures and shapes on the screen with a cursor.

UFO: A row of UFO's sit on the top of the screen and your spaceship scrolls from the left of the screen below them, firing one shot at a time to remove parts of the UFO's. Every time you hit a UFO you score a point and you start scrolling from the left of the screen again. Missing a UFO or hitting the right side of the screen loses you points.

Code: Based on the game Mastermind, the computer thinks of a 4 digit number and you have to guess it within a set number of guesses. Once you enter a number the computer tells you which number is correct in the right place and which number is correct in the wrong place.

Asteroids: Your spaceship has hit an asteroid field and like the game Klingons you have no gun but instead of ramming the asteroids you must avoid them for as long as possible.

Bomber: The game is viewed from the side as you watch a Bomber fly from left to right across the screen. The land is below with a dam on it and you must drop a bomb to hit the dam. Each dam that you see appears in a different location.

Kaleidescope: This is program based on the toy where you see dots moving about the screen making symmetrical shapes. There is no interaction from the player.

Guillotine: A two player game based on the pen and paper game Hangman but instead of saving your self from being hanged you must stop yourself from getting your head chopped off by a Guillotine. Player One enters a word and Player two has to type in letters to guess the word. Get a letter right and it appears in the word but get it wrong and a Guillotine starts to appear.
title: 10 Games

description:
1K Games Pack is a collection of 11 games and programs on one tape. The collection consists of:

Slot machine: You have 10p and you play a slot machine for 1p a go trying to get three numbers the same (10p) or the numbers add up to seven (5p).

Etch and Sketch: This a program that allows you to draw pictures and shapes with a cursor.

Slalom: Gates move down the screen and you have to align yourself to go through them without hitting them or missing them altogether.

Catch me if you can: You must move an X to catch a O that moves about the screen.

Space Pirate: You must attempt to dock your spaceship as it moves down the screen with another ship that moves left and right across the screen.

Spacefire 1: You are on the left of the screen while the computer is on the right, firing bullets at each other attempting to hit the other player.

Spacefire 2: Same as 1 but now the computer moves left across the screen.

Car Crash: You must drive your car down the screen avoiding the other vehicles and the sides of the road.

Man-Eating Budgies: You are on the top of the screen and Budgies move up the screen and you must avoid them while collecting their eggs.

Maze: You are on the top of the screen and a maze moves upwards and you must navigate through it without hitting the walls.

The Wall: You move right across the screen and you must remove every part of a wall that moves slowly upwards.
title: 1K Games Pack

description:
2K Games Pack is a collection of six games and programs. The collection consists of:

Snail: You have $50 and the choice to bet an amount of money on one of four snails to reach the other side of the screen first.

Advice: A program which gives you a statement to take as advice.

Dice: You and the computer take it in turns to throw a dice and the winner is the one with the highest score after 10 throws.

31: The computer gives you a number and you decide whether to receive another one with the aim to get closer to 31 than the computer.

Sketch: A program allowing you to draw pictures and shapes with a cursor.

Reverse: A puzzle game where you have to put 10 mixed up numbers in order by selecting how many numbers from the left will be reversed.
title: 2K Games Pack

description:
It's 1849 and the American gold rush has just started. The player in this game is one of the many that set off to the west coast in search for the precious metal. He must dig his way through the earth and excavate the gold but at the same time avoid the creatures that move around under ground.

Forty Niner is viewed from the side and the player has a full view of the level. Starting at the surface the player digs tunnels through the earth and the goal is to collect all the nuggets. At the same time it's necessary to watch out for giant rats that burrow through the earth to get into the player's tunnel. It's possible to delay them by knocking down supports that causes cave-ins. The only way to kill a rat is to release a snake from its nest. At the same time there are gremlins which attempt to reach the entrance of the mine and thereby blocking the player's exit. To stop it from doing this the player has to return to the surface and replenish the main mound with the pile of earth that appears when the player digs.

The player earns more points the deeper he digs but he also has to walk further to replenish the mound. When all nuggets have been collected a cave opens which allows the player to move on to the next level. The new levels have more rats but there are less snakes to kill them with.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 2 doesn't look much different but there are more rats

title: Forty Niner

description: 3D Defender is a 1st person shooter where you have to save your planet from alien invaders by blasting and destroying them. You fly over the surface of your planet searching for the aliens with the aid of a radar which shows you any ships in close proximity. As you blast the aliens and attempt to avoid their lasers you must be careful not to hit the surface as this loses you one of 10 shields but you have an altimeter telling you your distance from the surface. Getting hit by a laser or an alien ship also loses you one of your shields. Destroying an alien ship gets you 250 points but letting them land loses you 50 points but you can get these back if you destroy them when they take-off again.
title: 3D Defender

description: Deathrider is a light cycle game where one player competes against the computer. The player has to steer his bike (whose tail continuously grows) around an arena while avoiding crashing into the AI rider, the walls or the bike's tail. The player earns points every time the opponent crashes and a game goes on until the player has lost all of his three lives. The speed of the game increases with time. There are three different arenas to race in: open arena which doesn't have any obstacles, torus arena which has a large obstacle in the middle and deadly arena which has a large amount of small obstacles.
title: Deathrider

description: In this text adventure you have been tasked by the Emperor to find the three pieces of his Sceptre and put it back together again. Each screen describes your location with any objects that can be seen as well as any exits. You type in commands with the keyboard to interact with your surroundings and objects.
title: Adventure

description:
Adventure Tape No. 1 is a collection of three text adventures where each adventure has screens showing text describing your surroundings and you type in commands with the keyboard to interact with your surroundings. The three adventures are:

Greedy Gulch: Set in a old western ghost town, you have to find gold and return it to the Main Street.

Pharaohs Tomb: You have to find a way to enter the tomb before attempting to find treasures to return back to an Oasis.

Magic Mountain: Explore and search a mountain for the Scroll of Wisdom.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Pharaohs Tomb: Start of your adventure.
Greedy Gulch: A few items to collect.

title: Adventure Tape No. 1

description: Alien Attack is a Space Invaders clone where your craft sits at the bottom of the screen while aliens above move in formation across the screen getting lower. You must blast all the aliens while avoiding their missiles that drop down or you lose one of three lives. At the start of the game you have shields above your craft but will slowly disappear from being hit from your shots or the aliens missiles. At the top of the screen, a mothership moves across the screen and when shot gives you extra points. There are 9 speeds to choose from (1-9) with 9 being the slowest.
title: Alien Attack

description: Alphaprobe is based on the arcade game Lunar Lander and sees you controlling the N.S.S. Alphaprobe attempting to land on a landing pad on the surface of various planets. Viewed from the side, you are dropped from your Mothershhip and you fall towards the surface of the planet using your thrusters to control your descent. You can move your craft left or right but you can't move your craft upwards, only slow the descent as you aim for the landing pad. Using the thrusters uses fuel but you can land on fuel dumps to increase your levels. Once you land then you move onto the next planet but it is game over if you land too fast (over 10 m/s) or run out of fuel. There are five skill levels (1-5) with 1 being the easiest and on levels 3 to 5 there are also spores in the air that need avoiding.
title: Alphaprobe

description:
Arcade Action is a collection of five games which include:

Overtaker: The aim of the game is to drive up the screen passing as many cars as you can in two minutes to get the highest score you can. You can move your car left or right, and increase your speed but you can't slow down and the faster you drive the quicker your score increases. If you hit other cars then you stop which also stops your score increasing.

Missile Man: Based on Galaxians, you must move your craft left or right at the bottom of the screen to blast and destroy the aliens above moving left and right. The aliens will drop missiles on you and occasionally an alien will move down the screen. If you are hit by a missile or an alien then you lose one of three lives.

Spacefighter Pilot: Your crippled Mothership is orbiting a planet but the planet residents are firing missiles upwards to destroy it. You control a crosshair at the top of the screen and you must move left or right and hit the missiles. If your Mothership is hit too many times then it is game over.

Greedy Gobbler: In this Pac-Man clone you must move about a maze eating all the dots while avoiding ghosts who are out to kill you. If you touch a ghost then you lose one of three lives but there are four power-pills that can be eaten to allow you to eat the ghosts for a limited time.

Extra Terrestrial: Your mission is to destroy the whole world before a timer reaches zero. You move across the screen to the right above a map of the world. Pressing keys 1 - 8 fires a missile and the number you press determines the range of the missile.

sample_screenshots.caption: Extra Terrestrial: Start of the game.
Missile Man: Start of the game.

title: Arcade Action

description: In the Atheneum Club, London, you have accepted a wager for £20000 that you won't be able to travel around Western Europe in 80 hours with Roger Partington-Smythe. To prove that you have taken the route you must buy souvenirs from twelve capital cities including Amsterdam, Vienna and Madrid. Starting with £1500 in your pocket, you must first decide whether to take the standard or express (more expensive) journey to the next city. As you travel between various stops between the two cities, random events happen like losing money or being delayed. When you reach your destination you must decide how much money to exchange for the cities' currency taking note that any currency you have left will be lost when you leave the city. You have a choice of souvenirs to buy before buying your next ticket to the next city.
title: Around Europe in 80 Hours

description: Asteroids is a clone of the Arcade version which sees your craft in the middle of an asteroid field and you must destroy all the asteroids to survive. The asteroids start off large and when you shoot one then it splits into two, and shooting an asteroid this size splits it into two again before being destroyed with another shot. Occasionally an alien craft appears moving across the screen and this can be destroyed for extra points. If you are hit by an asteroid or the alien craft then you lose one of three lives. You are able to turn your ship 360 degrees as well as move forward.
title: Asteroids

description: Asteroids is a clone of the Arcade version which sees your craft in the middle of an asteroid field and you must destroy all the asteroids to survive. The asteroids start off large and when you shoot one then it splits into two, and shooting an asteroid this size splits it into two again before being destroyed with another shot. Occasionally an alien craft appears moving across the screen and this can be destroyed for extra points. If you are hit by an asteroid or the alien craft then you lose one of three lives. You are able to turn your ship 360 degrees as well as move forward. There are three skill levels (1-3) and four players can play with each player taking it in turn when the last player is killed.
title: Asteroids

description: Based on the classic pen and paper game, Battleships has you competing against the computer on two 10 x 10 grids to sink all the computer's ships before it sinks yours. You place your various length ships vertically or horizontally on one grid while the computer does the same. Once all the ships are in place, you both take it in turns to choose a square on the other grid to fire a shot to hopefully hit an opponents ship. Both players take it turns until a player sinks all the other players ships.
title: Battleships

description: Bigflap Attack is viewed from the side and has you controlling a man below a large bird. The bird moves about the top of the screen and you have to move the man left or right and shoot at the bird. To kill the bird you have to hit it between the eyes, anywhere else won't kill it. If you miss the bird five times in a row then the bird swoops down and eats you and it's game over.
title: Bigflap Attack

description: Rock Crush is a variant of Boulder Dash. The player controls Diamond Dan who must be navigated through ten different caverns while collecting all the diamonds he finds. At the same time the player has to watch out for rocks. Standing under a rock for more than a short moment will lead to Dan being crushed. Each level consists of a single screen. Since there is not much space to move in the player has to plan ahead. This makes the game more puzzle oriented than the original Boulder Dash since there is only one correct path to take through the level. Another difference is that there are no monsters. The only way to die is to be crushed by a rock. After four deaths the game is over. When stuck the player can restart the level but that also leads to a life being lost.
title: Rock Crush

description: Dans Revenge is the sequel to Rock Crush. The games have similar graphics but unlike Rock Crush, Dans Revenge is not a Boulder Dash variant. The protagonist is the same, Dynamite Dan, and the objective is still to navigate him through ten caverns while collecting all the diamonds. Here though there are no rocks to be crushed by. Instead there are monsters that move back and forth in predefined paths who will kill Dan if contact is made. Once all diamonds have been collected a secret door appears that the player has to reach to move to the next level. After four deaths the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting out with the first level

title: Dans Revenge

description:
After failure on your last mission and recovering in hospital growing a new arm and leg, you have had time to find and study the base of the Cosmic Guerillas, the Black Star. The location is a huge industrial complex on an asteroid and when you have fully recovered you are going to attempt to destroy it. Now fully recovered and your Svelgian Raider craft rebuilt and modified you are flying over the base looking for the valley containing the energy ducts. After one run you prepare yourself to fly down the valley again and finally destroy the base.

The game is a 1st person shooter where you fly down the valley and using your sight drop bombs on the energy ducts that you pass. You can speed up or slow down your craft and you are able to move your sight left or right. Below your sight is a small radar and this shows any ships flying behind you. On the sides of the main playing area you can see a timer counting down, amount of bombs, fuel levels, power, speed and score. The faster you travel the more power and fuel you use.
title: Black Star

description:
Bomber is a collection of four games to help the player learn the multiplication tables from zero to ten. Before the player can play Bomber or the three tablegames, they have to take a test with the option of one number or mixed numbers. Once the test is passed then it's onto the games:

Bomber: A question is asked and a row of numbers move from left to right on the bottom of the screen. When the answer the player thinks is correct is below the bomb they release it.

Tablegames

Shootout: A question appears on the screen and the player has to answer it as quick as possible before it disappears. Get it right and the question is shot and a score is given after 25 questions.

Four-in-a-Row: There is a 4 x 4 grid and the player selects one of the squares and attempts to answer the question inside. The aim is to get four correct answered squares in a row horizontally, vertically or diagonally.

Numbervaders: The player controls a craft at the bottom of the screen left or right and receives a question. Numbers fall down the screen and the player has to shoot the correct falling answer.
title: Bomber

description: Breakout is a clone of the arcade game and has you controlling a bat at the bottom of the screen, moving it left or right. You must deflect a ball upwards to hit a wall above and remove the bricks to make the wall disappear. If you let the ball go past the bat then you lose one of nine lives. There are nine skill levels (1-9) which dictates the speed of the ball.

sample_screenshots.caption: The wall is starting to disappear.

title: Breakout

description: Breakout is a clone of the arcade game and has you controlling a bat at the bottom of the screen, moving it left or right. You must deflect a ball upwards to hit a wall above made up of pound signs and hitting one turns it into a dollar sign. Hit a dollar sign and it disappears and the aim is to remove the whole wall and make as much money as you can. If you let the ball go past the bat then you lose one of ten lives.
title: Breakout

description:
Breakout 3 is based on the arcade game Breakout but instead of the bat on the bottom of the screen, the bat is on the left side of the screen. The aim is to hit bricks on the right of the screen to make them disappear but if you let the ball past the bat then you lose one of three lives. Before the start of the game you can choose whether to play with one or two bats, and playing with two bats has them parallel to each other a small distance apart. There are also three types of games to play and they are:

Practise Game: A normal game with the choice to choose the speed of the bat (1-4) with 1 being the slowest.

Progressive Game: Every time you hit the ball it speeds up and also removing a set of bricks makes the ball faster.

Acceleration Game: The ball will speed up for every 10th brick disappearing and it speeds up when all the bricks have been removed.
title: Breakout 3

description: Brick-Stop has you controlling a bat close to the middle of the screen, moving it left or right. Blocks fall from the top of the screen and you must stop them falling with the bat to make a barrier of bricks. If you complete the barrier then the game will restart. Any blocks that pass the bat pile up on the bottom of the screen and if they reach the same level as the bat then it is game over. There are nine skill levels to choose from (1-9) and this dictates the amount of blocks that fall.
title: Brick-Stop

description: Bubble Bugs are trying to destroy your base by moving across the screen from right to left and bombing the base when they reach the left side of the screen. You control an attack craft moving left or right below, firing missiles upwards to destroy as many Bugs as you can while avoiding their bombs. Firing missiles though uses fuel and to re-fuel you can either go back to the base on the left of the screen or wait till you run out and an rescue craft comes and re-fuels you. The rescue craft will also repair your craft if you are hit by a missile. There are 10 skill levels (1-10) with 1 being the slowest the Bugs move.
title: Bubble Bugs

description:
Bumper 7 is a collection of seven games and programs which includes:

Repeat 20: Based on Simon but instead of colours you get numbers. The computer gives you a sequence of four numbers which you then copy. If correct then the computer will add a number on to the sequence for you to guess.

Ski Slalom: You must control a H and move it left or right to go in between gates that move up the screen.

Paper Stone & Knife: Based on the game Rock, Paper, Scissors, you must decide whether to use Paper, Stone or Knife to beat the computer's choice. Paper beats Stone, Stone beats Knife and Knife beats Paper.

Snowflake: You must catch snowflakes that fall down the screen.

Patterns: This a program that lets you watch patterns appear on the screen.

Banco: Based on the card game Punto Banco and the idea is to get the nearest to nine.

Sketch: A program that allows you to draw shapes and pictures with a cursor.
title: Bumper 7

description: Tennis for the ZX81 is essentially a clone of Pong with the points system carried over from the sport. The game is made for two human players who share the same keyboard and there is no support for AI players. The court is viewed from a top down perspective and each player has to try to use the paddle to deflect the ball past the paddle of the opponent. Some customization options exist such as the speed of paddles and balls. It's also possible to choose if a match should be three or five sets long.

sample_screenshots.caption: Balls won is shown at the top

title: Tennis

description:
Can of Worms is a collection of eight games and programs with an adult theme and contains:

Acne: You are Dr. Frankenstein and you have brought your monster alive, but problem is, his face is breaking out in acne. You must move a cursor around the monster's face and remove as much acne as you can.

Vasectomy: You are a surgeon and your latest surgery is a vasectomy but you are drunk and the patients 'manhood' seems to be moving around all over the place. You have to move a pair of scissors around the screen to catch the moving organ and snip it in the right place.

Smut: A program that shows four random words on screen attempting to show a smutty sentence.

Hitler: Hitler is alive in an old people's home in Cambridge and moves about in a wheelchair. You have been given the task to kill him by giving him a heart attack. To do this you must place a whoopee cushion underneath him by picking a number on where you think he will stop. You have to successfully place the cushion ten times to kill him.

Dole: You are in Government and you you are presented with five items and their figures which are Cuts, Inflation, Majority, Dole and Term. You must survive for as long as possible by adjusting the figures to keep everyone happy and not get the sack.

Royal Flush: The King is on the toilet but the pipes are prone to suffer blockages. It is your job to remove the offending blockage by choosing a number between one and nine and then flushing. Too little flush and the blockage stays, too much and the King gets covered.

Reagan: Plays like Acne but instead of removing spots you have have to remove grey hair from the head of former President of the USA, Ronald Reagan.

P's 'n' Q's: You want to pee but the toilet appears in various places and you have to make sure your stream hits the bowl. You choose a number between one and ten to choose the power of your peeing.
title: Can of Worms

description: Yoogor is a puzzle platformer. The player controls Yoo who has to retrieve his lost shield and bring it back to his castle. The game is viewed from the side and the game world is divided into single screen sections. Yoo can walk left and right and climb platforms up and down but he can not jump. Climbing down from platforms is a must since any falling will lead to an instant death and game over. To make progress through the world the player has to open gates by activating switches found around the world. There are also locked doors that require finding a key. Potions can be picked up and after that Yoo can survive falling from a platform which is necessary when there is no other path to take. But there are also bad potions that can kill Yoo and which the player has to watch out for. Clues are given in the form of messages written for each screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Interacting with switches causes the gate to open

title: Yoogor

description:
Cassette One is a collection of eleven games and programs that contains:

React: Your plane flies from left to right across the screen above a nuclear reactor and missile bases. You have to bomb the reactor within a time limit and the bases also can be bombed. As you fly you can move up and down to avoid the missiles fired at you.

Invaders: A Space Invaders clone where you have to move a craft left or right at the bottom of the screen to destroy the aliens in formation above.

Phantom Aliens: You control a missile launcher which moves left or right to try to destroy aliens moving across the top of the screen from left to right. Part of the aliens have a shield and if your missile hits the shield then it bounces back down and can destroy your launcher if the missile hits.

Maze of Death: You have to escape from an invisible maze while trying to avoid a DIS (Dreaded Invisible Something). You are told what distance you are from the escape point.

Planet Lander: You are presented with various instrument readings like height, velocity and fuel. You must adjust the figures to land safely on a planet.

Bug Splat: You control a foot by lifting it up and down to squash bugs that run along the screen from left to right.

Bouncing Letters: A game for three players that sees each player controlling a letter below rows of the same letters moving across the screen from right to left. The players have to place their letters in the other letters to make the whole row match their letter.

I Ching: A program that allows you to ask a question and get the answer in I Ching Hexagrams.

Code Break: Based on the game Mastermind where you have to guess four letters in the correct order that the computer is thinking off. Once you have guessed, the computer will say B for the correct letter in the correct position and W for the correct letter in the wrong position.

Robots: A program that asks you how many robots you want on screen and the robots will move in a programed way making a pattern on the screen. Robot 1 will follow Robot 2, Robot 2 will follow Robot 3 etc.

Basic Hangman: Based on the pen and paper game which sees you try to guess a word the computer is thinking by selecting different letters. Get the letter right and it appears in the word, but get the letter wrong and the noose descends with five wrong guesses meaning you are hanged.
title: Cassette One

description: Alien Mind is a block pushing puzzle game. Unlike Sokoban this game is played from a side view and uses gravity. The player controls a small alien that can walk on air and whose job it is to push the right boxes onto the right shelves. Each level has multiple boxes and multiple shelves but it's only the box that's marked with an x that needs to be moved. The level is completed when the x-marked box is placed on the shelf that is also x-marked. However the other boxes are still important since they can create bridges that allow the player to push the x box to it's shelf. Pushing a box that is located beneath another leads to the alien being crushed. Only one box can be pushed at a time. In total there are thirty levels and once one is completed the player moves on to the next one. A code for the level is also given.

sample_screenshots.caption: Getting a code for next level
Using the o-boxes as a bridge
Stacking the boxes to reach the shelf

title: Alien Mind

description:
Cassette Two is a collection of ten games which contains:

Othello: Based on the board game, the idea is to fill a 8 x 8 grid with more counters than the computer. To remove an opponents counter you have to place a counter so that there is a number of opponent's counter between two of your counters. The opponents counters are then turned into your colour. Each player takes it in turn to place counters.

Awari: Based on an African game with sticks and beans, the idea is to move all your beans from your side of the pits and place them in your home pit. The amount moved into your home pit is depending on the amount of beans in the pits opposite.

Laser Bases: A strategy game where two players (one player and the computer) have ten bases each with an energy of three. The idea is to destroy all the others players bases with three choices for each base, Fire (3 energy), Shield (1 energy) or Nothing (0 energy). You write down your moves then tell them to the computer. The results for each base is then revealed.

Word Mastermind: The idea is to think of the five letter word the computer is thinking. After typing in five letters the computer tells you which letters are correct in the correct position and how many are correct in the wrong position.

Rectangles: Played on a 26 x 20 grid, the idea is to make bigger rectangles than the computer by placing two points on the grid to form a rectangle. Your rectangle won't show if the computer has points in your rectangle. You have to make rectangles big enough that won't get blocked.

Crash: You have to move a cursor that leaves behind a trail and catch the other cursor moving on the screen. To catch the other cursor you have to make it crash into your trail but you lose if you crash into it's trail.

Roulette: A gambling game where you have to bet on the the result of a wheel being spun with a ball and the number that the ball stops on. As well as picking a number you can also bet on the colour and other outcomes like the number is between 1-18, odd or even etc.

Pontoon: A gambling card game where you bet against the dealer to get 21 or the nearest to 21 without going over. You receive two cards and decide whether you want anther card or stick with what you have. Once happy with your cards the dealer then does the same. You win if you beat the dealer.

Penny Shoot: A penny falls from the top of the screen and you have to shoot it with a gun.

Gun Command: You have ten guns on the bottom of the screen and you choose which gun fires upwards to hit a plane flying above.
title: Cassette Two

description: Evil Xon and his forces are on a ridgetop encircling a valley full of his subjects. In this isometric shooter you control a craft moving it up or down, and the aim is to destroy as many of Xon's armaments as you can to reach Xon himself and bring him to justice. You have the choice of two weapons, a disruptor (more powerful) or a phaser, and you have the choice of turning your armour on and off. Moving the craft, using weapons, or having your armour on uses fuel shown by a gauge but fuel can be collected with a grappling hook or turning part of your score into fuel. If you crash or run out of fuel then it is game over. Once you have amassed 300000 points or played for two hours, you have the chance to grapple Xon with your hook.
title: City of Xon!

description:
Cassette 3 is a collection of eight games and programs which contains:

Starship 'Trojan': You are the sole survivor when your spaceship was caught in a meteor storm killing all on board. In this arcade adventure you must move about different compartments repairing them before your air drops below 3000 units and the ship performs a interstellar jump in 70 hours. You can also keep the ship on course so it doesn't plunge into a super-nova. There are various specimens running around the ship that need stopping with your laser or stun grenades.

Startrek: Based on the TV series, you play the role of Captain Kirk as you attempt to destroy all the Klingons in various Quadrants on a 8 x 8 grid. You give various orders in your mission while also trying to survive.

Princess Kraal: An arcade adventure where you must move through a maze of dungeons to rescue the Princess from various evil wizards. You must fight monsters and creatures while avoiding the traps.

Battle: A strategy game for one to four players on a 26 x 20 grid where each player attempts to destroy all the other spaceships by moving around the grid and firing missiles.

Cube: A program that allows you to set up a Rubiks Cube and attempt to solve it.

Secret Messages: A program that allows you to type in messages that are then coded. The messages can be passed on to friends for them to read.

Martian Cricket: Explosive balls are thrown on to a pitch and you have to run to as many edges of the screen (indicated by an arrow) as you can to score runs avoiding the balls. There are ten speeds to choose from (0-9).

Kalabriasz: A card game with the aim to reach 500 points before the computer does. You are given six cards and you then input the score of all the sequences you have (three or more cards). You then place a card from your hand with the computer called tricks and the idea is to get a better trick than the computer to score points.

sample_screenshots.caption: Startrek: The set-up for the next game.

title: Cassette 3

description:
Cassette Four is a collection of eight games and programs that contains:

Guns: A game for one or two players where two gunmen stand on either side of the screen and attempt to shoot each other once to kill them. Each player has six bullets and when the bullets run out then the player must wait a short time before their gun reloads. A carriage moves up and down the screen which deflects bullets back to the player who shot and kills them if hit. There are three skill levels (1-3) and the speed of the bullets can be chosen (1-6)

ZX-Scramble: A player controls a ship through a tunnel viewed from the side and the screen scrolls constantly from left to right. The player has to bomb enemy installations while avoiding or shooting missiles and bombs. If the player hits a bomb, missile or crashes into the tunnel walls then they lose on of ten lives.

Snakebite: The player controls a cursor and must attempt to remove the tail of a moving snake by hitting it's tail. Each time the tail is removed then it disappears and the end of the snake becomes the tail. The player has to avoid hitting the head of the snake.

Fungaloids: The player controls a craft at the top of the screen in multiple directions attempting to bomb fungaloids to stop them growing into the sky on the surface. Some fungaloids will fire a spore into the air and this must be avoided and cannot be bombed. On the surface are entrances to bases and these cannot be bombed either. The craft has a certain amount of fuel and bombs but more can be collected in the stores on the sides of the screen.

Invaders: Based on the game Space Invaders, the player controls a craft on the bottom of the screen moving left and right to destroy aliens in formation above. There are bases above the player as well but will slowly be removed when the player or the aliens hit them with their weapons. The player can also activate a shield for a short period of time. The speed of the game can be chosen (1-100).

Life: A program that allows the player to draw a pattern on the screen with the letter O and then allows the pattern to come to life and grow within a set of rules the computer has.

3D Tic-Tac-Toe: A 3D version of Noughts & Crosses but instead of one 3 x 3 grid the game is played over four 4 x 4 grids to place their o on.

Galaxy Invaders: The player controls a craft on the bottom of the screen moving left or right and must destroy all the aliens moving around the screen. The player has seven lives and the speed of the game can be chosen (1-100)
title: Cassette Four

description:
Cassette Five is a collection of eight games that contains:

Planetoids: Based on the game Asteroids, you control a spaceship in the middle of the screen and the aim is to destroy the Planetoids that move about the screen. Unlike Asteroids, the Planetoids don't split into two but parts disappear. You can turn 360 degrees, move forward and even hyper-space to another part of the screen. An alien ship occasionally appears and can be shot or avoided. Before the game you can select the speed of the game (1-100) and the difficulty (1-100) which dictates how much of a bonus you receive when you clear the screen.

Breakout: Based on the Arcade game, you control a bat moving it left or right on the bottom of the screen and the aim is to bounce a ball upwards to remove bricks above. If the ball passes the bat then you lose one of nine lives. Before you the game you can select the speed (1-999).

Space Rescue: A ship moves across the top of the screen and you must drop a rescue craft from it to fall down the screen. As the craft falls you can move it left or right to avoid Asteroids that move across the screen. Once landed on the planet below you pick up one of six stranded astronauts to take back up the screen. As you move upwards you must avoid ships but now you can accelerate and fire a beam at them.
