You must also make sure you dock with your ship and if successful you drop down again to rescue another astronaut. There are four skill levels, Beginner, Amateur, Skilled and Professional.

Draughts: Based on the board game, the aim is to capture your opponents pieces by jumping over them to take the piece if the square behind is clear upwards. There are three skill levels (1-3).

Byte-Man: Based on Pac-Man, you must move about a maze eating all the dots while avoiding three ghosts. If you touch a ghost then you lose one of three lives but there are power-pills and if eaten allow you to eat the ghosts for a short time. There is a choice of 3 mazes.

Dodgems: You move a vehicle around lanes eating dots while avoiding another vehicle because if you hit it then you lose one of three lives. Your vehicle is always moving forwards but you can change lanes through openings of the lanes. Before the game you can select the speed of the game (1-9).

Blitz: You control a plane flying above a city full of buildings and you have to bomb them all before your fuel runs out. The plane always moves forward but you can move up and down while you drop a bomb one at a time to remove parts of the buildings.

Merchant: A trading game that sees you in Venice in the Renaissance period with one ship, 2000 Florins and a debt of 5000. You must buy and sell items and sail to other cities to buy and sell more items. When you set sail then dangers can appear that can make you lose your cargo but you can buy more ships. The aim is to make 1000000 Florins.
title: Cassette Five

description: Castle Adventure is a text adventure with graphics showing a map of one of the two floors you are standing on. You must explore both floors to kill a dragon and a giant cobra by finding a magic sword to kill them. Each floor has four rooms in a North, South, East and West direction with text describing each room and you type in one of eight commands to interact with each room. Solving a problem in any room means you cannot enter it again. You will find other creatures and items in the rooms and if you are hit then you lose 20 energy points from 100.
title: Castle Adventure

description:
Challenge! is a collection of five games and programs that contains:

Brands Hatch: You must move a cursor round the racing track Brands Hatch in the fastest time.

Cartoon Man: A program that lets you walk a man across the screen forwards and backwards at different speeds.

Road Race: A two player game where you must move a cursor along two different routes from London to Scotland in the quickest time.

Juggler: Four objects are in the air and you must move a man between them to keep them in the air for as long as possible.

Meteor Strike: The Earth is being hit by a meteor storm and you must move the countries left or right to stop them from being hit.
title: Challenge!

description:
The Challenger 1 is a collection of two games that contains:

Amazer: You have to move an 'O' through a maze from the top all the way to the bottom of the screen. As you try to find the correct route, two stars move about the maze trying to stop you. If you are touched by a star then it is game over. Before the game you can select the speed (0-9) with 0 being the fastest.

Tic Tac Toe: Based on the pen and paper game, you have to try to get a horizontal, vertical or diagonal line of X's in a 3 x 3 grid before the computer does.

sample_screenshots.caption: Amazer: Waiting to enter the maze.
Amazer: Finding a route to the exit.

title: The Challenger 1

description:
Community Chest is based on the game Monopoly and is a smaller version of the game. You play the computer and try to make money without going bankrupt. The game has 16 squares with 13 squares named after London streets, Community Chance, Jail and a Go square. The street squares are split into six sets. Each player takes it in turns to throw a dice to move their counter and if a street square is landed on then the player has a choice to buy it if the player has enough money. If the player has brought a street to make up a set then houses can be brought and placed on the square.

As the players move buying streets and a player lands on a street square owned by the other player then that player has to pay rent and the cost depends on how expensive the street is and if there are any houses on it. Landing on a Community Chance square reveals an incident and this can either lose or gain the player money. The Jail square forces the player to pay a fee and if a player passes the Go square then they receive £2000. A player will lose the game if they go bankrupt.
title: Community Chest

description:
City Patrol and Sabotage is a double game pack containing the following two games:

City Patrol: In this 1st person shooter, you are in command of a Laser-Cannon Platform and you must defend your city from alien invaders attempting to destroy it. Controlling your sights, you must move about the city, scrolling left or right, in search of the invaders. Once you find one you must blast it before any damage is inflicted to the buildings or yourself. As you fire you must be careful as you can also destroy buildings as well. Your Laser-cannon can take five hits before it is destroyed and it is game over. Before the game you can choose a skill level from moderate, difficult or impossible.

Sabotage: The game is set in a ammunition compound viewed from above with the whole compound on the screen. You have the choice of playing either as a saboteur trying to place an explosive and cause as much damage as he can, and a guard trying to prevent the saboteur from succeeding. Playing as the guard sees you trying to predict the movements of the Saboteur in a set number of moves. You are armed with a truncheon and if close to the Saboteur then he will move out of your hitting range. You must try to corner the Saboteur or prevent him moving to his target as he will blow himself up. Points are awarded or deducted for any prevention or damage caused. Playing as the saboteur now has you trying to place the explosive while avoiding the guard who now is armed with a rifle in a set number of moves. Once again points are awarded or deducted according to how much damage is caused or if you are caught or shot.

sample_screenshots.caption: City Patrol: There's an alien invader.
City Patrol: Ready to save the city.

title: City Patrol and Sabotage

description:
Concentration, Number Challenge and Word Challenge are three games to use your brain and test your memory:

Concentration: A one player game where you are presented with a 8 x 8 grid full of hidden pairs of letters. You choose a square and a letter is revealed, then you choose another square and hopefully match the same letter. If they don't match then the letters disappear and you choose two more squares. If they do match then the pair of letters stay on the screen.

Number Challenge: A game based on the game Simon for one to six players and each player has three turns to get the highest score memorising sequences of numbers. Each player can choose from one of three games a turn, Straight Forward, Back Up, and Both Ways with each one having varying levels of difficulty and scoring more points. Straight Forward has the player watching a sequence of numbers and then typing in the same sequence. Get it right and the computer then adds a new number to the sequence. Back Up has the player having to type the sequence backwards and Both Ways needs the sequence typing in forwards and backwards.

Word Challenge: Based on the game of Boggle for one to six players with each playing attempting to make as many words as they can from a 5 x 5 grid full of mixed letters. As a timer counts down, each player must write down as many words as they can from the letters in any direction but the letters must touch. At the end of the timer, each player writes down their score and the winner is the player with the highest score.

sample_screenshots.caption: Word Challenge: Find as many words as you can.

title: Concentration / Number Challenge / Word Challenge

description: Counter Attack is a clone of the arcade game Scramble where the player is seeking revenge for the bombing of their planet by bombing a city belonging to the attackers on the planet ZX81. The game is viewed from the side and scrolls from left to right constantly, and you can move your ship up or down. As you fly and bomb the surface below, you must watch out for missiles that fly upwards but these can be avoided, bombed or shot with your laser. You can also thrust forward to speed up and avoid them. You must keep an eye on your fuel levels as it decreases but you can increase it by bombing fuel dumps on the surface. if you are hit by an missile, crash into the surface or run out of fuel then you lose one of five lives.
title: Counter Attack

description: Croaka-Crawla is a clone of the arcade game Frogger where the player must control a frog and get him to the other side of a road and river. The game is viewed from above and the first thing to cross is a busy road full of traffic scrolling across the screen. You can move left, right or forward as you dodge the traffic to reach a river bank. Once the road has been survived then a river must be crossed by jumping on logs or the backs of turtles that scroll across the screen as well. Once you reach the other side of the river you must jump into a gap and occasionally a baby frog or flies appears for extra points. If you get hit by a vehicle, fall into the river, or touch the sides of the screen then you lose one of three lives. Before the game you can change the speed of the game (1-100) with 1 being the fastest.
title: Croaka-Crawla

description:
Damper/Glooper is a double games pack that contains the following:

Damper: A city in the jungle is losing it's power due to Leeches on the grid. In this maze game you must move along the grid and damp the dotted lines which turns them solid. As you move around the grid, Leeches also move about and if you touch one then you lose one of three lives.

Glooper: A Pac-Man clone where you have to move about a maze to eat all the dots while avoiding three creatures moving about the maze. If you touch a creature then you lose one of three lives but there are power-pills that can be collected and this allows you to eat the creatures for a short time.
title: Damper/Glooper

description:
The Damsel and the Beast is an arcade adventure where you must search 35 rooms of a darkened Palace to kill a Beast and rescue a Damsel before escaping the Palace. The whole Palace is in pitch blackness and you must move about feeling your way with walls appearing briefly if you hit them but you are shown if you have been in a place before. You have on your person a certain amount of clubs and torches, but step on a hole and you lose half of what you are carrying. Clubs allow you to knock down some walls or throw and you must have a least one or the game is ended as you cannot kill the Beast without one.

Torches shine a light in a straight line, stopping when it hits a wall before going out. If the beast is awakened then he will come looking for you and any trails he finds he will follow but the Beast must be killed before you can get the Damsel to follow you if you find her. Once the Beast is dead and the Princess is following you, you must find the exit before she starves to death. Before the game you have three skill levels and they are Easy, Medium and Difficult.
title: The Damsel and the Beast

description: QS Asteroids is a fairly basic conversion of the original arcade game. The action starts immediately after loading (no title or options screens here) and players finds themselves in a space ship in the middle of the screen with numerous asteroids passing by. To control the ship, two keys are used for rotating it, one for shooting and another for thrusting it forward. Shooting can be done in eight directions. On an unmodified ZX81, the ship is represented by a number which changes with rotation (For example 0 means it's pointing up, while 4 is down) and the asteroids are o's, while users with a QS CHRS board get graphics more similar to the arcade original. The player starts with three ships and after 10,000 points a bonus ship is given. Asteroids appear in waves. The first one has two large ones and the number increases with each new wave.

sample_screenshots.caption: Running without the CHRS board and it looks a bit basic

title: QS Asteroids

description: QS Invaders is a clone of Space Invaders and plays the same as the original. The player controls his laser cannon down the bottom of the screen and has to shoot the alien invaders that move back and forth above him while at the same time avoiding their fire. Three shields offers some protection. Occasionally a saucer worth a large amount of points will appear at the top of the screen. As the invaders decrease in number they will speed up and once they reach the baseline the game is over. The game is also over when all three of the player's laser cannons have been destroyed. Prior to starting a game the player can choose from three different difficulty levels.
title: QS Invaders

description: Scram - 81 is a clone of the arcade game Scramble which is viewed from the side with the screen scrolling left to right constantly. You have to fly a spaceship above the surface of a planet bombing ground targets while shooting or bombing missiles with your laser. As you fly, your fuel level decreases but you can bomb fuel dumps to increase it. If you hit a missile or the surface then you lose one of three lives.
title: Scram - 81

description: Scramble is a horizontal side view shooter where the screen scrolls from left to right constantly. You control a spaceship and you have to fly over the surface of a planet and blast all alien ships and missiles that fire upwards towards you. As well as a laser to fire at the aliens and missiles, you also have one smart-bomb which destroys everything on the screen. If you touch an alien ship, missile or crash into the surface then you lose one of three lives. Before the game starts you can choose the speed of the game (1-10) with 10 being the slowest.
title: Scramble

description: QS Scramble is a clone of the arcade game Scramble. It's a side-scrolling shooter where the player controls a space craft flying over the surface of an alien planet. Movement is limited to moving up and down and there are two weapons to attack with: forward going missiles and bombs that are dropped onto ground targets. Five missiles can be fired at a time and three bombs can be dropped at a time. Targets include aliens that swoop down from above and rockets that launch from the ground. On the ground there are also fuel dumps. The game goes on until the player has lost all three lives or the fuel runs out.
title: QS Scramble

description: You are the commander of a submarine and you must search the surrounding waters looking for enemy ships with the aid of a radar and periscope. Using the radar allows you to see the location of any ships and if any are seen then you can adjust your power of your engines and direction. Once you are near to a ship you can switch to periscope mode and look around your position 360 degrees. Once a ship is seen and in range you can fire a torpedo and hopefully sink the ship. Once sunk then you look for more enemy ships with your radar. You also have the option to dive and this is useful for when the enemy drop depth charges but your air gauge needs checking. If air is low then you can surface and open a snorkel. Before the game you have three skill levels and these are Beginner, Professional and Expert.

sample_screenshots.caption: Enemy ships seen on your radar.
One ship sunk, seen another one.

title: Sea Wolf

description: Space Intruders is a clone of the arcade game Space Invaders where you move a craft, left or right on the bottom of the screen blasting a formation of aliens above. The aliens above just move left and right dropping bombs and don't descend down the screen. In between yourself and the aliens are four shields which lose parts every time you or the aliens hit one. If you are hit by an alien's bomb then you lose one of three lives.
title: Space Intruders

description: Space Invaders is a clone of the arcade game where you move a craft, left or right on the bottom of the screen blasting a formation of aliens above. The aliens above move left and right dropping bombs slowly descending down the screen. In between yourself and the aliens are four shields which lose parts every time you or the aliens hit one. If you are hit by an alien's bomb or an alien lands on the surface then you lose one of three lives.
title: Space Invaders

description:
Dodgems and Connect 4 is a double games pack that contains:

Dodgems: You move a vehicle around lanes eating dots while avoiding another vehicle because if you hit it then you lose one of three lives. Your vehicle is always moving forwards but you can change lanes through openings of the lanes. Before the game you can select the speed of the game (1-9).

Connect 4: A strategy game where a player either plays the computer or another player on a 7 x 6 grid dropping counters down each column. The idea is for a player to make a row of four counters in a vertical, horizontal or diagonal line to win the game.
title: Dodgems and Connect 4

description: The aim of Dragon Maze is to get through an invisible maze from one side of the screen to the exit on the other side while avoiding a dragon trying to kill you. Before you start you have the option of having a quick look at the maze or the chance to see the maze being drawn before it disappears. You can move in a North, South, East or West direction and if you hit a wall then that part of the wall stays on the screen. While you attempt to move through the maze the dragon moves about and if he finds you, he will kill you and it is game over.
title: Dragon Maze

description: Escape from Shazzar! is a text adventure where you have to recover a thruster from your spacecraft from the Temple of Shazzar. To enter the temple you need a treasure value of 500 so you must search the surrounding areas looking for treasure. Each screen is described by text and you must type in commands with the keyboard to interact with each location. As you explore you will come across monsters that need fighting and you have a strength rating which can decrease and when it reaches zero it is game over. Before the game you have a choice of six skill levels (1-6) with 1 being Novice and 6 being Idiot.
title: Escape from Shazzar!

description: Family Quiz allows one player to answer ten questions on a variety of subjects from a choice of five answers a question. There are four quizzes that can be loaded and in each quiz is five sets of ten questions. Once a player has played five sets then the quiz repeats itself but with the answers in a different order.
title: Family Quiz

description:
Fantasy Games is a double games pack containing the following adventure games:

Perilous Swamp: Deep in a Perilous Swamp, your quest is to find and rescue a Princess held captive by an evil Wizard before escaping out of the swamp. You are presented with a map of your surroundings and text tells you any objects you can see. As you move around the swamp you will encounter various creatures who you can fight, run from or bribe (if you have enough treasure). If you choose to fight then you decide how many combat strength points to use. Spells can be found and used to help you on your quest.

Sorcerer's Island: Similar to Perilous Swamp, this time you are on an island and you must attempt to leave it. One difference is you can encounter people like the King of the Dwarves and the Grand Sorcerer himself to help you.
title: Fantasy Games

description:
The First is a collection of three games that contains:

Byte-Man: A Pac-Man clone where you must clear a maze of dots while avoiding being caught by three ghosts. If you are caught then you lose one of three lives but there are power-pills that can be collected and this allows you to eat the ghosts for a short time.

Star Fighter: Earth is being invaded by a huge Zylorian invasion force and you have been tasked to hold them back for as long as possible. The game is a single screen shooter viewed from the side where you control a craft on the left side of the screen moving up or down. The aliens move from the right of the screen and you must blast them trying to let none past you. If you are hit by an alien or it's missiles then you lose one of three lives and if the amount of aliens is too much then you can warp to another part of space, once every life. Although you cannot stop the invasion force, the more you destroy the easier it will be for Earth to defend itself.

Bomber: Your mission is to fly repeatedly over a dam and bomb it to inflict as much damage as you can with 30 bombs. Your plane just flies from left to right over the single screen and you press any key to drop the bombs. Parts of the dam are worth different amount of points.

sample_screenshots.caption: Star Fighter: Blast the alien invaders.

title: The First

description: Frogs is a game where you have to help eight frogs cross a river hopping from boat to boat one at a time. The game is viewed from above seen on the whole screen and the frog you want to move sits at the bottom of the screen. The boats scroll across the screen in alternate directions from left to right and right to left. Once you reach the top you must place a frog on one of five piers at the top of the screen. If a frog hits the water or touches the side of the screen then that frog is lost. Before the game you can select a speed (1-9) with 9 being the slowest.
title: Frogs

description: High-Rise Hive is a platformer where the player is a bee that tries to steal all the honey from the hive's honey cells and keep for himself. To reach higher places in the hive ladders are used since jumping is not possible (falling is though). Other bees refill the cells but will sting the player if they get the opportunity. The hive is five screens in size with one third consisting of underground labyrinths. The player starts at the top of it and for every level cleared moves deeper down into it. For each new screen the hive gets wider and there are more bees buzzing around until the underground is reached where there are as many as twenty bees on the screen at a time. After completing the final screen the player moves on to an extra tough mega-hive. The positioning of honey cells in the hive is randomized for each playthrough. When stung by a bee the player respawns at the bottom of the screen but keeps the honey collected. It's possible to be stung 30 times before the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting out at the top of the hive

title: High-Rise Hive

description:
Galaxians & Gloops is a double game pack that contains:

Galaxians: Based on the arcade game, you control a craft at the bottom of the screen, moving left or right, blasting alien ships in formation above firing missiles at you. As you blast the aliens, some aliens will swoop down firing missiles as well. If you are hit by an alien or its missiles then you lose one of three lives. Before the game you have a number of options that can be selected and they are speed (0-9), firing rate (0-9) and how many swoop at one time (0-9).

Gloops: A Pac-Man clone that has you moving about a maze eating all the dots to clear the maze. As you eat the dots, Gloops move around the maze as well and if you touch one then you lose one of three lives. There are power-pills and if you eat one then you can eat the Gloops for a short time. Before the game you have two options that can be selected and they are speed (0-9) and a choice of ten mazes.
title: Galaxians & Gloops

description: Galaxy Invaders is a Space Invaders clone where you control a craft on the bottom of the screen moving left or right, blasting aliens above in formation. The aliens move across the screen slowly descending downwards. As you blast the aliens, you must avoid the bombs that they drop because if you hit one or allow an alien to land on the bottom of the screen you lose one of three lives. Between your craft and the aliens are five shields but parts disappear when hit by your bullets or the alien's bombs. Before the game you can choose the speed of the game (0-9) from easy to very hard.
title: Galaxy Invaders

description:
The Gambler is a double game pack that allows you to gamble with two games that contains:

Blackjack: A card game that sees a player try to get to a total of 21 or closer than the dealer (computer) without going over and being bust. The player starts with $100 and can set the minimum amount to bet but the maximum is $50. Both players receive two cards with one card from the dealer shown. The number cards are worth the same value and picture cards are worth ten and aces are either one or eleven. The dealer asks the player if they want another card and the player keeps receiving them till they feel that they are close to 21 or have 21. Once the player stops then the dealer plays and the player wins if they beat the dealer.

Slot Machine: The player has £100 and can bet any amount on every spin. When the player spins the machine a line of three letters appears and the player wins if the sequence matches any of the sequences on the right of the screen. A player cannot bet an amount of money if they don't have it in their funds.
title: The Gambler

description:
Games II is a collection of three games that contains:

City Bomb: Your plane has run out of fuel and is gliding downwards over a derelict city. As you scroll left to right, you must bomb the buildings to remove them to create a landing strip for your plane. You are able to fire missiles forwards as well and your bombs and missiles are limited. Hit a building and you lose one of three lives.

3D Battle: In this 1st person shooter, you control a sight and you must move about space searching for aliens to blast.

Gridball: A two player game based on table football where the players must try to get a ball to touch the other players side of the screen. The players control five columns of bats and can move them up or down to bounce the ball.
title: Games II

description:
Astro Invaders is a collection of five games that contains:

Astro-Invaders: A Space Invaders clone where you control a craft at the bottom of the screen moving left or right, to destroy aliens in formation above dropping bombs on you. The aliens move across the screen and slowly descend trying to land on the bottom of the screen. As you blast the aliens, you must avoid their bombs or it is game over if you are hit by one. Occasionally an alien will appear and move across the top of the screen from left to right and when hit will award you bonus points. Between you and the aliens are five shields but will lose parts every time you or the aliens hit them with your weapons.

Arcade Grand-Prix: You must control your car left or right, and keep it on a constantly moving road without hitting the sides. if you hit the sides of the road it is game over. There are four difficulty levels to choose from (1-4) with one being the fastest and four being practise.

Penalty: You are a goalkeeper and you must try to save penalties kicked at your goal. You move the keeper left or right and you can't move until the ball has been kicked.

Golf: You must try to hit a ball into a hole with the hole moving to various positions when you get the ball in a hole. You select the angle of your shot and how much power you want (1-100). There are also bunkers on the course to contend with.

Swat: You move a man left or right and you must try to swat an insect on the screen with your swatter.
title: Astro Invaders

description:
Starfighter / Pyramid / Artist is a collection of three games and programs that contains:

Starfighter: A 1st person shooter where you move your sights around the screen to blast alien ships that come into view to save your civilisation. You must destroy as many as you can before your energy reaches zero.

Pyramid: A puzzle game where a Pharoah has asked you to move his pyramid, made up of 9 layers from one location to the other. The pyramid is on Base A and it needs to be moved to Base C but you can only put a layer on to a larger layer. If you put a large layer on to a smaller layer then it will crush it and you have to start again.

Artist: A program that allows you to move a cursor to draw on the screen.
title: Starfighter / Pyramid / Artist

description:
Fawkes Computing's Gamestape 1 is a collection of four games that contains;

Dodge It: You must move around the screen eating dots through lanes while avoiding a monster. You can't stop but you can change lanes through the gaps and when you touch the monster then it is game over. As you eat the dots they will turn to crumbs and eating crumbs turns them into dots. You have a choice of skill levels and these are Learner, Novice, Expert and Suicide.

Trojan Dragon: You are in control of the defences of a castle and you must allow the good guys in while keeping out the bad guys. There are two entrances into the castle, a drawbridge and going up a dragon's back into the battlements. You raise or lower the drawbridge to let people cross the moat or fall into it, and you have a man appear to stab people on the battlements. If the dragon raises it's head then anyone on it's back stops. If you allow a bad guy into the castle then you lose one of three lives. You have a choice of difficulty (Easy, Difficult and Very hard) and speed (Slow, Moderate and Fast).

Death Trap: You control a star on the screen and every time you move a black square appears along side you. The aim is to keep moving so you are not surrounded by black squares. You have a choice of difficulty (Expert and Novice) and speed (Slow, Fast and Very Fast).

Tablets of Hippocrates: A text adventure that sees you enter a Enchanted Forest to retrieve tablets that are in two parts, which have the cure for cancer on them. The screen has text which describes your location and you type in commands with the keyboard to interact with your surroundings.
title: Fawkes Computing's Gamestape 1

description: The Gauntlet is a clone of the arcade game Scramble which is viewed from the side with the screen scrolling horizontally constantly from left to right for one to two players. You control a spacecraft and you must fly over a mountainous planet's surface bombing various installations while avoiding missiles that fly upwards. As well as your bombs you are also armed with a laser that fires forward. As you fly, a fuel gauge decreases and you need to bomb fuel dumps to keep your fuel levels up. If you are hit by a missile, crash into the surface or run out of fuel then you lose one of three lives and it's the 2nd players turn if two player is selected.
title: The Gauntlet

description:
Gold is a double game pack that contains:

Gold: A text adventure that sees you in the Yukon camping when a thick fog comes down. You realise this was the same conditions that a prospector was lost in and rumour has it, he hoarded treasure. You decide that you will search the surrounding area for the hopefully real treasure. Text is shown on the screen describing each location and you type in commands to interact with your surroundings.

Pick a Word: You play the computer and the aim is to take it in turns to pick words from a choice of nine and be the first to choose three that have the same letter in them. There are a choice of two levels (1-2) with the 2nd level being harder.

sample_screenshots.caption: Gold: Glad the spider isn't here.
Pick a Word: Which word next?
Gold: Title screen and start of your adventure.

title: Gold

description: Grimm's Fairy Trails is a maze game and you play the role of Young Prince Billy who spends his life being chased by two Maze Dwellers, Murph and Drago. To finally defeat them, you must move about the maze collecting dots to get 250 B-Lers (life crystals) to make the maze dormant. If you touch either Maze Dweller then it is game over but in the centre of the maze is the Sacred Stone of Ross which awards you an extra life, once per game. There are six levels of play to choose from (1-6) from Poison Apple to Super Prince.
title: Grimm's Fairy Trails

description: Noir Shapes is a remake of the Xbox 360 Indie game Cool Shapes. It's a polyominoes puzzle game where the player has to fit a number of shapes within a frame of a certain size. With the use of a cursor the player can pick up and move the shapes individually and place them in the right spot of the frame. To complete a level all pieces has to be correctly arranged with no overlapping before the time is out. Each level has a four digit code that can be entered at the main menu to get direct access to that level. The game has a total of 60 levels which is twelve more than the original game. The Xbox 360's avatars have been replaced with an animated image of Clive Sinclair.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting out with the first level

title: Noir Shapes

description: Gulp! is a maze game viewed from above seen on the whole screen and you have to move about, eating all the dots to clear the maze. As you eat the dots, an Ogre chases you and if you touch it then you lose one of five lives. Before you play, there are a number of options that can be chosen and they are: choose a maze out of five different ones, speed (1-9) and grade (1-9).
title: Gulp!

description: Hangman is based on the pen and paper game where a player has to guess a word by picking letters of the alphabet. If the letter is correct then it appears in the word but get it wrong and a picture of a man being hanged appears in stages. The game can either be played as a one player game (against the computer) or multi-player with 2-9 players. The one player game has five categories to choose from and these are Animals, Science, States, Countries and Fruit & Veg. In a multi-player game, one player types in a word and the other players guess the word and points are awarded if players fail to get a player's word. An option to create a category and put in words is also available.
title: Hangman

description:
J.D. Arcades is a collection of three games that contains:

UXB: You have to move around a maze to catch four tumblers, which are numbered and must be collected in the correct order. Once you have collected them all then you must get to the detonator before a fuse reaches it. If you collect the wrong tumbler or hit the fuse then it is game over.

Strategic Invaders: A Space Invaders clone where you control a base moving left or right, blasting aliens who are above in formation, moving across the screen, slowly descending downwards dropping bombs. Between your base and the aliens are shields which lose parts every time you hit one or the aliens do. One unique feature is that each position on the screen your base is on, only has nine shots. It is game over if you get hit by an aliens bomb or you allow them to land.

Laser Patrol: A side view shooter where you must move a spacecraft up or down to either avoid or blast asteroids that move across the screen from right to left. if you hit an asteroid then it is game over.
title: J.D. Arcades

description: Keys to Gondrun is a text adventure where you journey beneath the Enchanted Forest and attempt to find the missing keys of Gondrun the Wizard. The screen has text describing your surroundings but instead of entering commands you are given choices in each location. As you explore you may be attacked by various creatures and these are fought in real time so you have to be quick in your actions or be killed if your strength rating reaches zero. Before the game you can choose your skill level (1-6) from Beginner to Plain Reckless.
title: Keys to Gondrun

description: You are the ruler of a Kingdom and in this strategy game you must keep your land prosperous and and your subjects content. Each turn is played over one year and the player has to make decisions to make money, keep your population busy and to attract more people to live in your Kingdom. You must build cities, factories and ships as well as farm and mine the land by employing your subjects in the various areas. After a year is up then you are given a report on your progress and whether you are still the ruler for the next year.
title: Kingdom of Nam

description:
Krypton Ordeal is a double games pack that contains:

Krypton Ordeal: You have crashed on the Planet Krypton and to survive you need to reach a city while your oxygen decreases. Your starting position and the location of the cty is viewed from above on the whole screen. The residents though don't just let anyone enter the city, so as you move in multiple directions, you will be given puzzles. These take the form of guessing numbers between 1 - 100 and matching sequences. If you get a puzzle wrong or you run out of oxygen then it is game over. Before you start there are two skill levels to choose from, Difficult and Very Difficult.

Hole-in-One: A golf game with the course viewed from above with each course seen on the whole screen. To hit the ball you choose a compass direction like North or South West etc, and you choose how much power you want to use (1-100). There are 36 courses to play (you can choose how many) and each course has bunkers, trees, rough and water. If the ball is in the rough or bunker you have to hit the ball harder.

sample_screenshots.caption: Hole-in-One: The ball is in the hole.
Krypton Ordeal: A puzzle has been given.

title: Krypton Ordeal

description: ZX81 Labyrinth is a 1st person perspective maze game where you must move through a maze to find the exit. Before you explore a maze you have the choice of the size of the maze from the width (3-15) and the height (3-9), and you can decide whether to take a compass with you. After you have built your maze you are presented with a map for a short time to study it for a route. To move about the maze you move forward and turn left, right or behind you. If you have chosen a compass then you can bring it up to show your direction and Help brings up a map for a short time.
title: ZX81 Labyrinth

description: Lost Island is a text adventure where you have survived your ship sinking and are now floating on a piece of driftwood with an Island in view ahead. You must get to the Island and explore it to help you survive. The screen has text describing each location and you type in commands with the keyboard to interact with your surroundings.
title: Lost Island

description: Your mission is to move to the bottom of the sea to rescue sailors trapped in a stricken sub. You start at the top of the screen with an oxygen level of 60 which decreases and you move downwards while avoiding or shooting sharks that move across the screen. When you reach the bottom, you must enter the sub and bring a sailor out and back to the top of the screen to a safety tank. There is also an oxygen tank that can be entered to top up your levels. If you touch a shark or run out of oxygen then it is game over.
title: Marine Rescue

description: Your quest is to enter a maze to explore it and find the treasure before returning back to your start position. The maze is viewed from above with part of the maze shown on the screen. As you explore you will encounter Mazogs and to defeat them you need to find a sword, you can fight without one but your chances of winning are reduced. A sword can only be used once to fight but there are many swords scattered around the maze. You will also encounter prisoners bricked up in the walls and they will give you a route to the treasure, but the route only appears for ten seconds so you will need to move as quick as you can. A map showing part of the maze can be brought up at any time showing you any Mazogs, prisoners, swords and the treasure if near. Before the start of the game you have three difficulty levels, Try it Out, Face a Challenge and Maniac Mobile Mazogs.

sample_screenshots.caption: Map of part of the maze.

title: Mazogs

description: You control a base on the bottom of the screen moving left or right, and you have to blast or avoid falling meteors with your laser over five waves. As you avoid or blast the meteors, you also have a panic button which removes all meteors on the screen but using this reduces your bonus. A wave ends when your base is hit and you move to the next wave but with the meteors falling faster. Before you start the game, you can select three levels of difficulty, Slow, Fast and Expert.

sample_screenshots.caption: Game over. (I think the fact that ZX81 didn't have sound, also affected my descriptions)

title: Meteor Storm

description:
The Mixed Game Bag 1 is a collection of three games and programs that contains:

Bowling: A game that allows you to play ten frames of Ten-Pin Bowling by throwing the ball down a top view bowling lane at ten pins. When you throw the ball you can move it up or down until it reaches two X's on the sides, then you have no control of the ball. Normal bowling scoring applies.

Robot Wars: A Mastermind game set in the year 3082 where political battles are decided by robots fighting. To defeat your opponents robot you have to guess a four digit number it is thinking. After your guess the robot will tell you how many numbers are correct and in the correct sequence, and how many are correct but in the wrong sequence. You have ten guesses to win the battle.

Bingo: A number generator program that calls out random numbers to aid in a game of Bingo.

sample_screenshots.caption: Robot Wars: Waiting for guess result.

title: The Mixed Game Bag 1

description:
Mixed Game Bag 2 is a collection of three games that contains:

Memory Magic: The computer will flash up a sequence of numbers, letters or both (your choice) and you have to type in the correct sequence. You have five levels (1-5) and this dictates how many characters in the sequence.

Concentration: You have an 8 x 8 grid and you have to select two squares to try to get the same letters. If you fail to get a match then the two squares disappear, but if you get them right then they stay on the screen.

Supermind: Based on Mastermind, the computer is thinking of a sequence of symbols and you have to guess them. Once you have guessed then the computer will tell you how many are correct in the correct sequence and how many are correct but in the wrong sequence. There five levels to choose from (1-5) and this dictates how many symbols the computer is thinking.
title: Mixed Game Bag 2

description:
Mixed Game Bag III is a collection of five games and programs that contains:

Blitz: You are flying a plane running out of fuel and the only option to land safely is to bomb a city below to create a landing strip. You fly left to right across the screen slowly descending downwards, but you can move up or down. Once you have dropped a bomb, you are unable to drop another one until the bomb hits a building or the ground. It is game over if you hit a building or run out of fuel and you have a choice of speed (1-255) with 1 being slowest.

Rat's Nest: There is a rat running around the screen leaving a trail behind it and you have to move about the screen to box it in. If you hit the Rat's trail or move back on yourself then it is game over. There are a choice of speeds (1-250) with 1 being the slowest.

Snake: You move a snake's head with a tail around the screen to catch falling dollar signs. As you collect the dollar signs the game will get faster and your tail shorter.

Sketch Pad: A program that allows you to draw shapes and pictures by controlling a cursor on the screen.

Cross the Road: You are on the right of the screen and you have to get to the left of the screen by avoiding the cars moving up the screen. Hit a car and it is game over.
title: Mixed Game Bag III

description: Munchees is a Pac-Man clone where you must move around a maze to clear it by eating all the dots. As you eat the dots you have to avoid ghosts and if you touch one then you lose one of three lives. There are power-pills that can be eaten and these allow you to eat the ghosts for a short time. You have a choice of how many ghosts on the maze (1-4).
title: Munchees

description: The aim of Murgatroyds is to move around a grid avoiding the creatures but trying to get them to hit mines scattered on the screen. You move using a compass direction (North or South West etc.) one place at a time and once you have moved then all the creatures move one place at a time. Occasionally a creature will move two places and it is game over when you are caught.
title: Murgatroyds

description:
Ocean Trader is a trading game set in the 19th Century where you own a sailing Barque and you must sail between five ports around the English and Welsh coast to make £500000. Your base is in Swansea with £480 and a loan of £4600, and you can buy up to 50 units of various goods like General, Arms (illegal), Coal, Whiskey and Bullion (illegal). Once you have brought your cargo you can set sail for the ports of Liverpool, Southampton, London and Newcastle but you may encounter hazards on your voyage.

Hazards that can be encountered are storms, fog and Pirates but you can arm your ship with cannons at a cost but these can prove to be unreliable. Occasionally you may encounter abandoned ships but some may be used as a trick by Pirates. If you collide with another ship then your ship will have to be towed to the nearest port but for the cost of £500 and if you don't have the money then you will be impounded and it is game over. Once you reach your destination you can then sell your cargo and buy more but you will also receive bills that need paying.

sample_screenshots.caption: What do you want to buy?

title: Ocean Trader

description: Othello is based on the board game where each player attempts to have more counters on the board than their opponent on a 8 x 8 grid. The game starts with both players having two counters in the center of the board diagonal from each other. To take another piece, the player places a counter to have a number of their opponent's counters between two of the player's counters, vertical, horizontal or diagonal. The opponent's colour is then turned into the player's colour and it is then the other player's turn. This carries on until the board is full or no counters can be placed. A player can either play against the computer or another player and there is a Fast or Slow Mode.
title: Othello

description: Pac Rabbit is a Pac-Man clone where you take the role of a rabbit and you move about a maze eating all the dots to clear the maze. As you eat the dots you must avoid the hounds that are hunting you but you can eat magic carrots which enable you to eat the hounds for a short time. If you touch a hound then you lose one of ten lives. There are six mazes split into two parts, Rabbits Revenge and Run Rabbit Run and you can choose the speed of the game (0-9) with zero being the fastest.
title: Pac Rabbit

description: Peloponnesian War is a strategy game set in the war between Athens and Sparta in the years 431 BC to 404 BC. You take the role of Athens and you must build your Army by conquering or convincing other States in the surrounding areas to boost your numbers up. You also need to keep an eye on the Spartans and protect States from their advances. Once you are happy with your numbers, you can then have one final battle against Sparta. There are three levels to choose from (1-3).
title: Peloponnesian War

description: Pengy is based on the arcade game Pengo where you have to move about a maze and move the walls made up of ice blocks to crush Sno'Bee's moving about the maze. If you push an ice block into another block then it disappears and you gain points, push a a block with a space behind it and it will slide until it hits another block. To defeat the Sno'Bee's you need to slide the blocks to hit them but if you are hit by a Sno'Bee then you lose one of three lives. There are three speeds to choose from Slow, Fast and Hell.
title: Pengy

description:
Phoenix Adventure is an arcade adventure where you must find and kill a Black Phoenix over four parts with an energy of 100. The parts you will encounter are:

Hexagonal Room: You are in a room with eight doors leading to eight rooms described with text. Inside the rooms are creatures and traps and you must enter each room finding objects to take to other rooms to receive other objects. If you enter a room that has been solved then you lose 15 energy.

Land of the Goblins: You have been teleported to a large area viewed from above on the whole screen. You start on the left of the screen and you have to reach an exit on the right side of the screen. Also in this area are Goblins and Dragons and you must avoid them or lure the Goblins into swamps and find a sword to kill the Dragons. You move one place at a time in eight directions before each creature moves one place each and if you touch a creature you lose energy. Food can also be collected to give you energy boosts.

Coded Room: This part takes the form of a wordsearch grid full of letters and you must move around the grid horizontal and vertically to make a message. The message must be continuous and if you get a letter wrong then you lose energy and have to start the grid again with a new message.

Land of Phoenix: You are now in an area viewed from above with the whole area seen on screen. There are five locations and also where the Phoenix lives and you must explore the locations to equip yourself for the final showdown. The locations are Pit, Caves, Castle, Swamp and Forest and like the Hexagonal Room, there are objects and traps, and you must enter each one to get the objects to help you receive other objects. Once you are equipped you can go and face the Phoenix.

sample_screenshots.caption: You have the sword and are going to escape.

title: Phoenix Adventure

description: Pinball recreates a pinball table where the aim is to keep hitting a ball to score as many points as you can with two flippers. The table is equipped with bumpers and letters spelling TIMEX, as well as two lanes that when entered give bonus points. There are also two outside lanes that when entered lose the ball and if the ball also passes the flippers then you lose one of five lives.
title: Pinball

description:
Pioneer Trail is based on the game The Oregon Trail where you have to travel 2000 miles across America with your family in 1847 from Westport Landing to Oregon within 40 weeks. You start off with 2 old horses, a wagon, four rifles and $700 and you must decide how much to buy of oxen, food, bullets, clothes and supplies. Before you set off you must test each rifle with some target practice shooting bugs.

When you are ready to travel you are given choices, stop at next fort, hunt or continue on your travels. You can buy supplies at the forts but are more expensive than your starting position, hunt allows you to attempt to shoot an animal. Before you start your next stage of the journey you have to decide how much food to eat from one to ten with ten being big rations. As you travel you will be presented with situations like how to deal with travellers and Indians, bad weather, losing supplies, illness and injuries to your family, and trading. There are 21 skill levels to choose from (0-20) with zero being beginner and 20 being experts.
title: Pioneer Trail

description:
Planet Raider is a double game pack that contains:

Planet Raider: A side view horizontal shooter with the screen scrolling left to right constantly, as you control a craft moving it up or down over a planet's surface. You must fly over a mountainous terrain, city and through caves bombing installations on the ground. Alien ships will fly towards you and these can be blasted with your laser. If you hit the surface, an alien or it's bullets then you lose one of three lives.

Pirate Treasure: You are on a top view beach and you must attempt to collect as much gold and silver as you can. As you move around collecting treasure, pirates appear attempting to surround you so you must keep moving. If you are surrounded by the pirates and can't move then you lose one of three lives. Once you collect a certain amount of treasure then you can collect diamonds. There are five difficulty levels (1-5).

sample_screenshots.caption: Pirate Treasure: Pirates trying to stop you.

title: Planet Raider

alternate_titles.title: Do You Know Your Pop Stars?

description: Test Your Knowledge of Pop Music is a quiz game between one to four players on British music from either 1960-1970 or 1971-1980. There are nine topics to choose from and they are Who's Number 1 Hit Was This, Name the Hit 1 and 2, When Was this at Number 1, What Was Number 1 Then, Match the Works 1 and 2, Who's Hit Was This, and Pop Luck. There are 20 questions for each topic and each player chooses a number to receive their multiple choice question with six answers. Each player takes it in turn to answer a question and the winner is the player with the most correct answers.
title: Test Your Knowledge of Pop Music

description: Presidents is a quiz game where you answer questions about Presidents of the U.S.A. and you can select the number of questions you want to answer. You have a choice of two types of questions, you are either given the years of a President's term in office and you guess the name, or you are given a name and you have to give the years of a President's term in office. You have two attempts a question and at the end you are given a scoreboard to see how you have done

sample_screenshots.caption: Hope this is the correct years.

title: Presidents

description:
Program Pack 4 is a double games pack that contains:

Breakout: Based on the arcade game where the aim is to remove all the bricks at the top of the screen by moving a bat left or right below and bouncing a ball upwards. If you let the ball pass your bat then you lose one of three lives.

Brikthru: Moving a bat left or right and bouncing a ball upwards, you clear the screen with a ball going through a shaded area and bouncing off the top and sides of the screen. If you let the ball pass your bat you lose one of thee lives.
title: Program Pack 4

description: The planet Zargon is under attack from an alien invasion and you have been tasked to fly your craft and blast as many aliens as you can to beat their score from their bombing raids. The game is a horizontal side view shooter with the screen scrolling from left to right constantly. As you fly over the surface of the planet you will encounter various alien crafts and all must be destroyed with your limited amount of lasers but you can get more by landing on landing pads. If you are hit by an alien craft or it's weapons then you lose one of five shields and when they reach zero you lose one of five lives. Being hit by bombers or hitting the surface loses all the shields in one go and loses you one life. There are six levels to choose from (1-6) with six being the hardest.
title: Protector

description: The Puzzler as the name suggests is a puzzle game where the idea is to turn a black pyramid into an upside down white one. You are presented with the pyramid and you must slide various size blocks into empty spaces. There is a storage area as well that can hold blocks as you move the blocks into the correct positions. The game can be saved to come back to later and if you manage to solve the puzzle then you can attempt another puzzle but with two black pyramids.

sample_screenshots.caption: Make the white an upside down pyramid.

title: The Puzzler

description: Raider is a Scramble clone that has you flying over the surface of a planet before flying through a cavern bombing the installations and missile dumps. As you fly, missiles and aliens will fly towards you and you can either bomb them or use your laser. You are able to move your craft up or down, and left or right to avoid the missiles and aliens as well. If you hit a missile, alien or the planet's surface then you lose one of three lives. A fuel gauge decreases as you fly but you can increase it by bombing fuel dumps.
title: Raider

description: Ram Runner is a snake style game where you move around the screen leaving behind a trail as you search for runners to ram, shown by the letter R. To clear the screen you must ram all the runners while avoiding obstacles and if you hit an obstacle, hit your trail or go back on yourself then you lose one of three lives (called rounds). There is also a letter E to collect for bonus points and if you clear the screen then you receive an extra life. There are 26 difficulty levels to choose from (A-Z).
title: Ram Runner

description: Bouncing Bert is a platformer played from a traditional side view perspective although with unusually large sprites. Therefore only a small part of the level is shown at a time. The objective for each level is to find and collect three keys and bring them to the exit. Controls involve walking left and right and jumping. In addition to the normal platforms there are conveyor belts and platforms that the player sinks through. Various hazards and baddies have to be avoided as any contact will lead to a life lost. These include weeds and skulls. The player has five lives in total.

sample_screenshots.caption: An obstacle moving up and down
Trying to jump over this baddy

title: Bouncing Bert

description: Impact! is a clone of Asteroids that keep most of the gameplay features of the original arcade game. The player controls a spaceship that is surrounded by asteroids moving around him. The player has to destroy these by shooting at them. Larger asteroids are split into smaller ones that has to be shot until they are fully destroyed. Controls involve rotating the ship left and right, using thrust to move forward and brake to slow down. A hyperspace jump can also be used to avoid collisions. Keys used can be redefined by the player. The alien saucers from the original game are however not included. Upon colliding with an asteroid one life is lost. The player starts out with three lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: Asteroids split into smaller ones when shot

title: Impact!

description: In-Between is a simple card based betting game. The player is shown three cards with the middle one being upside down. The player's task is to guess if the value of the card in the middle lies between the values of the two other cards. The player starts with 10 dollars and can then choose how much he wants to bet. The game then continues with new cards being shown until the player has lost all his money.

sample_screenshots.caption: The middle card is shown and I earn a couple of dollars

title: In-Between

description: tetris1k is a basic Tetris clone that is designed to work on an unexpanded ZX81 with only 1KB of memory. It plays as can be expected from a game of Tetris with the player being able to move blocks left and right, rotate and insta-drop them to the bottom. A later update of the game has a counter showing how many lines have been cleared although this was not available in the original version.

sample_screenshots.caption: Score counter shows number of lines cleared

title: tetris1k

description: Wiwo Dido and the Case of Mazeddy's Castle is a maze game that uses hi resolution graphics on an unexpanded ZX81 with only 1KB of memory. Due to these constraints only a small part of the screen is shown at a time, which is the part that is lightened up by Wiwo Dido's torch. Wiwo Dido has fallen through the roof of emperor Mazeddy's castle and now he has to make his way through it's corridors to find the exit. To be able to get out he has to locate five keys that are scattered around the maze. Once they have all been collected the exit will open on the right side of the maze. Found keys are shown on top off the maze. Movement is possible in four directions using keys QAOP.

sample_screenshots.caption: I can see a key, but how do I get there?
Collected keys are shown on top of the maze

title: Wiwo Dido and the Case of Mazeddy's Castle

description:
Super Scramble is a variant of Scramble that consists of six stages with different obstacles and enemies. Like the original arcade game it's a side scrolling shoot 'em up set inside a cave where the player can shoot at targets in front of him as well as dropping bombs at ground targets. Here the cave is inhabited by a wicked witch that the player has to destroy.

At the first stage stalagmites grow across the cave that the player has to blast his way through while later stages add other obstacles such as stalactites and erupting volcanoes. Later in the game there are vampire bats. With one sitting on the ship it can no longer climb, with two it's necessary to steer upward to avoid falling and with three the player is doomed unless he can brush them off on a cave wall. At the final stage the player will meet the witch herself who has to be shoot on the nose while her magic spells are avoided. The game be played by one or two players (hot seat) and a skill level 1-5 can be selected before starting.

sample_screenshots.caption: Suddenly large rocks fall from the cave
These are worth quite a lot of points

title: Super Scramble

description:
Chopper Drop 3000 is a single screen shoot 'em up. The player controls a helicopter and has to drop bombs on an enemy tank that moves on the ground beneath him. At the same time he has to avoid being hit by projectiles not only from the tank but also from a flying object that moves around above him. While hovering stationary the bombs are dropped straight down while when in motion the bomb retains the forward inertia and falls at an angle. The player has to be aware of the helicopter's fuel level but by destroying tanks the fuel is recharged. When hit by a projectile the game ends and the player gets a score based on how many tanks have been destroyed. As the tank count increases the game gets more difficult.

The game is a remake of Chopper Drop, a 1K type-in game that the author wrote in 1983 and which was published in the New Zealand magazine Bits & Bytes in 1984.

sample_screenshots.caption: Trying to hit the tank while avoiding the projectiles

title: Chopper Drop 3000

description: ZXagon is a remake (or demake) of Terry Cavanagh's fast paced action game Super Hexagon. The game plays like the original game with the player controlling a small triangle attached to a hexagon in the middle of the screen. With the use of two redefinable keys the player rotates the triangle in an attempt to avoid the various shapes that continuously moves towards it. ZXagon doesn't have the various levels of the original game. It only consists of one endless level that goes on until the player collides with a shape. Due to the constraints of the hardware the game doesn't have solid graphics like the original, instead using a wireframe look.

sample_screenshots.caption: Trying to aim for the gap between the shapes
Suddenly there's only one gap to reach for

title: ZXagon

description: Pinbat is a combination of Pinball and Breakout. The player launches a marble from a plunger at the right side and the table consists of various bumpers and other objects like in real pinball but instead of flippers at the bottom there is a bat that the player moves left and right in an attempt to hit the marble before it goes out of play. At sidewalls the marble obeys the laws of reflection but at some objects like stars and grey blocks the marble is thrown off at a random angle. By hitting stars and other targets the player earns points. The game consists of five rounds each with a different table design and each round goes on until the player has lost three marbles.
title: Pinbat

description:
Super Programs 1 is a collection of six games and programs that contains:

Invasion From Jupiter: At the top of the screen sits a secret weapon from Jupiter, below it are Guardians protecting it from any attack below. You must destroy the Guardians by typing in a number from 20 to 99 and if the number is correct will remove a Guardian. You have 15 shots to destroy as many as you can.

Skittles: You have to roll a ball to remove 30 Skittles with six shots on the left of the screen. You move the ball up or down to place it level with a row and then roll the ball.

Magic Square: You have a grid with 15 numbers and a space and the aim is to move the numbers using the space to make a new pattern like odd numbers on the top and even numbers below.

Doodle: A program that allows you to draw shapes and pictures on the screen with a cursor.

KIM: A group of letters are on the screen and you must study them for a short time before the letters disappear. The letters appear back on the screen and you have to guess which letter is missing.

Liquid Capacity: A program to allow you to convert gallons/pints to litres and vice versa.
title: Super Programs 1

description:
Super Programs 2 is a collection of six games and programs that contains:

Rings Around Saturn: You control a spacecraft and you are trapped between two rows of circles moving right to left. You have to move your craft between any gaps to escape before your fuel runs out.

Secret Code: Based on the game Mastermind where you have to guess four numbers between one and six the computer is thinking off. Once you guess, the computer will tell you if any numbers are correct in the correct position (X) or correct but in the wrong position (O).

Mindboggling: Based on Boggle where a number of players see a grid of letters and have to make as many words they can in an agreed allotted time. The letters can be vertical, horizontal and diagonal to make up the word in a continuous line. Players score points for making a word no other player has made.

Silhouette: A program that allows you to draw shapes and pictures on a black background with a white cursor.

Memory Test: There are three levels with level one being the easiest and you have to remember and type in a group of letters the computer shows you for a short time.

Metric Conversion: A program that allows you to convert yards/feet/inches into metres/centimetres and vice versa.
title: Super Programs 2

description:
Super Programs 3 is a collection of six games and programs that contains:

Train Race: A program that can be used for a group of people to bet or have fun with, as they watch three trains race across the screen from left to right.

Challenge: Choose a number the computer will use as the highest limit and then try to guess the number the computer is thinking. The computer will tell you if your guess is too high or too low.

Secret Message: This program allows you to type in a message and then get a friend to press NEWLINE to see the message reveal itself.

Mind That Meteor: You control a craft as it moves up or down to get from left to right without hitting any meteors.

Character Doodle: A program that allows you to draw shapes or pictures using letters of the alphabet as the cursor.

Currency Conversion: A program that converts currencies to other currencies after the person inputs the exchange rate and amount they want converting.
title: Super Programs 3

description:
Super Programs 4 is a collection of six games and programs that contains:

Down Under: The aim is to get Joey into his Mum's pouch by pressing a number between one and ten for the distance you think he needs to jump.

Submarines: Based on Battleships, you have to sink a number of subs on a 10 x 4 grid by typing in the co-ordinates.

Doodling With Graphics: A program to draw shapes and pictures using the symbols on the keyboard.

The Invisible Invader: You have to move a craft around the screen to find an invisible invader by the directions the computer gives you.

Reaction: A letter appears on the screen and you have to hold that letter down as quick as possible.

Petrol: A program that converts petrol from miles per gallons to KM per 100 litres and vice versa.
title: Super Programs 4

description:
Super Programs 5 is a collection of six games and programs that contains:

Martian Knockout: You have the only missile launcher that can destroy spaceships so you have been tasked to destroy all the ships from the invading Martians. Your launcher sits on the bottom of the screen while the Martians sit on the top right. You have to type in a number between 1 and 99 for the velocity of the missile you want to fire. After every missile your launcher fires, you move nearer or further from the invaders. You have 15 missiles in total to destroy all of the Martians.

Graffiti: A program that allows you to draw shapes or pictures with a cursor on the screen.

Find the Mate: You have an 8 x 6 grid of black squares and behind each square is a letter. You have to pick two squares at a time to hopefully match the same letters. If you get a match then the squares disappear but if wrong then the squares appear again.

Labyrinth: You are outside a labyrinth and you have to move into the centre to get the treasure. Inside the labyrinth are guards and these need avoiding and will move one place every time you move one place. You have 110 sips of water and this decreases every time you move and if the water runs out or you are caught by a guard then it is game over.

Drop a Brick: Based on the game Breakout, you control a bat on the right of the screen and you move it up or down while hitting a ball to the left to destroy bricks. The ball doesn't bounce of the bricks, it just moves through them. If you let the ball pass your bat then you lose one of three lives.

Continental: A program that allows you to convert British clothing sizes like collars, brassiere, shoes and clothing, into continental sizes and vice versa.
title: Super Programs 5

description:
Super Programs 6 is a collection of six games and programs that contains:

Galactic Invasion: You have the only missile launcher that can destroy spaceships so you have been tasked to destroy all the ships from invading aliens. Your launcher sits on the bottom of the screen while the Martians sit on the top left. You have to type in a number between 1 and 99 for the velocity of the missile you want to fire. After every missile your launcher fires, you move nearer or further from the invaders. You have 15 missiles in total to destroy all of the aliens.

Journey Into Danger: You have to enter a maze viewed from above and reach the exit on the other side while trying to get as much treasure as you can within a time limit. As you explore the maze, you will encounter monsters and the computer will give you percentage of the chances of winning and you decide whether to fight or run away. Traps will occasionally appear and lose you valuable time.

Create: A program that allows you to draw shapes and pictures with a cursor.

Nine Hole Golf: You have the chance to play nine holes of golf with a hole and your ball shown on the screen. You first choose a direction from 0 (Horizontal) to 90 (Vertical) before choosing an Iron to hit the ball with (1-9).

Solitaire: Based on the board game, you have a cross shape board full of pegs with the centre empty. You must jump a peg over another peg into a space horizontal or vertical and remove the jumped peg. The aim is to get one peg left in the centre.

Daylight Robbery: You are outside a labyrinth and inside is 15 safe deposit boxes that need collecting within a time limit. There is also one guard patrolling and you must avoid him. If you collect a safe deposit box then the guard patrolling is replaced with a new one.
title: Super Programs 6

description:
Spelling Bee is an educational game where the player has to pick out the misspelled word from a list of five words. Each test consists of ten problems and at the end the player will get a score. There are both easy and difficult versions of the test. In the easy test the player only has to pick the misspelled word while in the difficult it's also necessary to type in the correct spelling. After playing at least one game it's possible to check scores, list misspelled words and to take a test with only words that the player got wrong before.

There are four programs on the tape each with problems adapted to a certain difficulty level. From third graders and under on the easiest level to tenth grade through preparation for college SAT on the hardest. Each program has 25 sets of words.

sample_screenshots.caption: Some tougher words on the higher difficulty

title: Spelling Bee

description: Invaders is a Space Invaders clone not to be confused with the other game called Invaders for the ZX81. The game plays like any other version of the shoot 'em up with the player moving the laser base along the bottom of the screen while shooting at the aliens that move back and forth above. Four barriers offer some protection from the enemy fire and sometimes a saucer worth extra points moves across the screen. The game ends when the player has been destroyed three times or the aliens land on the base line.

sample_screenshots.caption: They're getting a bit too close

title: Invaders

description:
Super Programs 7 is a collection of six games that contains:

Racetrack: You control a car by moving it left or right avoiding the sides of a track that scrolls upwards.

Chase: You move around a box trying to avoid a robot and the mines he leaves.

NIM: A strategy game between you and the computer where you select how many objects are to be played with and you take it in turns to pick up either one, two or three. The loser is the one who picks up the last one.

Tower of Hanoi: A puzzle game where you have to move layers of a pyramid from one location to the other by placing the layers in different locations without putting a large layer on to a smaller layer.

Docking the Spaceship: A large spaceship is on the screen and you have to move a smaller one into a gap at the bottom of the large ship. Once the smaller ship starts moving in a direction it won't stop moving and has to be steered to dock with the larger ship.

Golf: You play nine holes of golf with your ball and the hole on the screen in different positions and you attempt to hole the ball in the least number of shots. You first pick a direction to hit the ball based on the numbers of a clock before choosing the power of the shot (1-9).
title: Super Programs 7

description:
Super Programs 8 contains one game called Star Trail where you take the role of Captain Church of the UK spaceship Endeavour. Your mission is to rid the Galaxy of Klingons before they can start a large scale attack on the Mothership in 181 hours time. The Galaxy is divided into 16 quadrants, with each quadrant divided into four sectors. You must move around the sectors and quadrants searching for the Klingons and attempting to destroy them.

You ship is equipped with Short Range Scanners and Long Range Scanners, and these can tell you the locations of any nearby Klingons, Starbases and stars. For combat you have phasers and torpedoes which use up energy, and to protect you, you have a shield and you decide how much energy to go into your shields. As you search the galaxy you can also dock with Starbases which can repair your ship and this starts a small arcade sequence where you take control of your ship and attempt to move the ship into a gap in the base.
title: Super Programs 8

description: Cannon War is a shooter game where the player controls a cannon along the left edge of the screen. Other cannons will appear from the right side and shoot towards the player. If a cannon ball reaches the player's border he will lose a life and therefore it's necessary to shoot them down before they do so. The player can also attack the enemy cannons but to do so he has to move forward from his starting position into the screen and from there shoot at the enemies. Being stationed in the middle of the battlefield makes defending the border harder since there is less time to move the cannon vertically. Destroying a cannon ball is worth five points while destroying a cannon is worth twenty. At 500 points the player gets a bonus cannon. The game ends when all the player's cannons (three at the start) has been destroyed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Moving forward to attack while leaving the defence open

title: Cannon War

description: The tiny planet Tai is the last outpost between the advancing Imperial invaders and the planets of the Dorfain System and your mission is to defend the planet until the Republican Battle Fleet arrive to destroy the invaders. The Imperial invaders have targeted the planets core by sending ghostguards and fireballs to destroy it, so in your ship viewed from above scrolling vertically constantly, you must move left and right shooting anything that doesn't belong. If you touch a ghostguard, fireball or the walls then you lose one of nine lives, but if you shoot enough of the enemy then you move through the exit. You now join your Mothership in orbit around the planet and you must move about in various directions shooting any enemy ships. Hitting an enemy ship gains you fuel but getting hit reduces your fuel and when it runs out it is game over.
title: Tai

description:
Ten 1K Games is a collection of ten games and programs that contains:

Survival: A program that sees you sat on the screen watching bombs explode around you, seeing how long you can survive.

Typing: A typing tutor that allows you to select the speed of the program before typing the letter or number that flashes on a keyboard on the screen.

Reverse: A puzzle game where you have a row of mixed up numbers from one to nine and you have to select how many numbers to reverse to put the row in order.

Night Rally: You move up a road and you have to move left or right to avoid hitting the sides.

Airstrike: A plane flies above a target from left to right at different heights and you have to press P to try to bomb it.

Crocodile Swamp: A plane flies above a target from left to right at different heights and you have to jump out and move left or right to land on the target.

Missile Chase: A missile flies at the top of the screen and you control the speed (normal or fast) of an Exocet to intercept the missile.

Moonlander: Your craft falls down the screen and you have to move it left or right to land on a landing pad.

Music: A program that lets you listen to a tune.

Invader Dodge: Invaders move downwards and you have to move left or right to avoid hitting them.
title: Ten 1K Games

description:
Thro' The Wall also Scramble is a double games pack that contains:

Thro' The Wall: A Breakout clone where you control a bat on the bottom of the screen moving left or right, to hit a ball upwards and remove bricks above. If the ball goes past the bat then you lose one of three lives. There is a choice of the speed of the ball and they are Normal, Fast and Superfast.

Scramble: You view your craft from the side as it flies from left to right horizontally constantly, and you must avoid or shoot ground installations and enemy craft with your missiles. You can use a smart bomb to destroy everything on the screen but you only have one and if you hit the ground or any enemy then you lose one of three lives. You have the choice of ten speeds (1-10) with one being the fastest.

sample_screenshots.caption: Thro' The Wall: Hit the bricks

title: Thro' The Wall also Scramble

description: ZX Asteroids is based on the arcade game where you are a craft sitting in the middle of the screen surrounded by large asteroids moving about the screen. You have to blast all the asteroids, and when one is shot then it splits into smaller asteroids and keeps repeating the process until the asteroid has gone.
