You can turn your craft left or right 360 degrees but you can also move forwards. Occasionally an alien craft will appear and when shot gives you bonus points. If you are hit by an asteroid or the alien craft then you lose one of three lives. Two players can play and each player takes it in turns when the other player loses a life and there are five levels of play (1-5) with one being the easiest.
title: ZX Asteroids

description:
ZX Compendium is a collection of six games and programs that contains:

Alien Intruder: During a long space voyage to Earth, you have been woken from cryogenic suspension to find, to your horror, the rest of the crew devoured by an alien lifeform. To prevent yourself being the next item on the menu you have decided to collect enough essential supplies before escaping in a shuttle. The game is a text adventure with some graphics where the screen is split into two. The top half shows a map of one of the three levels of the ship with your location and the aliens if on the same level as you, a map showing your immediate surrounding area and any exits, and finally the supplies you need to collect which are oxygen, cells, water and food. The bottom half of the screen has text describing your current location and you type in commands with the keyboard to interact with each location. If you enter a location with the alien then you die but if the alien enters your location then you need to deal with the situation.

Wumpus Adventure: A text adventure that allows one to four players to move around an area hunting for creatures called a Wumpus to kill. Before you start the hunt you have a number of options and they are, choice of caverns (Novice, Random Cave Pattern and Professional Hunter), number of players, and if you hunt to the death or kill a certain amount of Wumpus. The actual game sees text on the screen describing each location of a player and the current player types in commands to interact with their surroundings. Each player gets one move before the next player has a turn. The players are armed with five arrows but more can be collected, and as well as Wumpus there are other creatures like Goblins and giant serpents that need to be dealt with.

Numerology: A program that allows you to enter your name and birth date to receive a reading about your personality and find out your lucky number, colour and day of the week.

Hangman: Based on the pen and paper game, you can compete against the computer or another person as you try to guess a word without being hanged. A word is generated and you have to select a letter at a time to try to make the word. If you guess a correct letter then it appears in the word but get one wrong and a man being hanged on a scaffold starts to appear. The computer has two levels (1-2) to choose from.

Hieroglyphics: You have to decipher 39 Hieroglyphics by placing a letter or a vowel combination under the correct symbol and the computer will give you a word to help you decipher them. You must be careful in your guesses though because each wrong guess sees trapped explorer Wullie Makeit's tomb slowly fill with sand.

Movie Mogul: A management game where with a limited budget you have to buy a script and attempt to make a movie and make a profit with it. After buying a script you decide which type of movie to make as well as hiring a director, actor and actress. You decide on each day of filming how much money to spend on various options watching your budget levels decrease. Once you have completed filming you are given a final score as a profit or loss for the finished movie.
title: ZX Compendium

description:
Zombies / Sword of Peace is a double games pack that contains:

Zombies: You have crashed on an island in the South Pacific and you are the only survivor. To make matters worse, the island is full of Zombies and even though they are blind, they can detect you by your heart beat. You move one place at a time and after each move all the zombies then move one place. The only way to survive is to lure the Zombies into the many potholes scattered around the island.

Sword of Peace: To become the Monarch of Oz you must prove your worth by being placed in a 100 x 100 grid dungeon and find four objects of state in this text only game. Each object is on a hotspot and you are told your grid reference and how far the nearest hotspot is. As you move about the dungeon you will encounter creatures who will either try to kill you or help you but you are armed with spells with more to be found. Once the four objects have been found then you must find the final hotspot to succeed in your quest.

sample_screenshots.caption: Sword of Peace: Moving further away

title: Zombies / Sword of Peace

description: Zuckman is based on the arcade game Pac-Man and has you moving about a maze attempting to clear it by eating all the dots. As you move around the maze there are four ghosts moving around as well and if you touch one then you lose one of three lives. There are power-pills though and when eaten, allow you to eat the ghosts for a short time.
title: Zuckman

description: 3D Grand Prix is a 1st person perspective driving game where you must race against various other drivers over five laps to win the race on a randomly generated track. You start on the grid and when the lights turn green you accelerate away changing up the six gears your car has. As you accelerate you need to keep an eye on your rev counter, have it too high and your engine will blow and it is race over. As you approach a bend you are told the recommended speed to take the bend and you are updated regularly with the weather. As you finish a lap the road surface becomes checkered indicating you can stop your car to use the pits.
title: 3D Grand Prix

description:
Dungeons of Doom is a double games pack with both games playing the same for one to four players but having different scenarios as you step into a deserted castle. In Dungeons of Doom you have to move downwards through the dungeons to find the treasure, while Escape from the Underworld has you falling through the floor and having to move upwards to the entrance to the castle.

The games are played on a 10 x 10 cube and on the screen you have a map of your location plus the surrounding areas. You must move around through the corridors and up and down stairs searching rooms that you encounter. There are hazards and creatures who occupy certain rooms and when you encounter a creature you have a short time to decide whether to fight, use a spell or retreat. You have a certain amount of hit points and this reduces with every trap, incident or a fight with the creatures. Each player has one move before the next player has a turn.
title: Dungeons of Doom

description: On your way home back to your planet in your spacecraft, you have encountered an asteroid field with the asteroids together in clusters. Viewed from above, you scroll down the screen as the asteroids move upwards but you are able to move left or right and shoot them with your destructer. Your main problem though is your craft only has 500 energy units remaining and you need at least 100 to land on your planet. Every movement you make, firing the destructer or using shields when you hit an asteroid decreases your energy and when it reaches below 100 then it is game over.
title: Planetoids

description: Pandemic is a sequel to the 2010 game Virus by the same author. The game plays largely the same as its predecessor but the game engine has been tweaked to allow for a larger amount of enemies. The game is till played from a top down perspective and the player can move and shoot in all directions (now also diagonally). The objective for each level is to clear all viruses. What's different from the first game is that all viruses are spawned from virus generators that have to be destroyed. If not then more viruses will continuously appear. To get through the levels health packs has to be collected since health continuously decreases over time and keys has to be located to open doors. There's no need to collect ammunition though since an endless amount is available from the start. The game is three times as large as its predecessor with a total of 24 levels.
title: Pandemic

description: Combat Flight is a side scrolling shoot 'em up. The player's task is simply to blast as many aliens as possible and controls their fighter ship up and down while the game automatically scrolls forward. In addition to the aliens, the player has to avoid crashing into the mountainous terrain. The game looks similar to Scramble but here there are no ground targets to attack. Killed aliens leave behind flak that the player has to avoid crashing into. The player has three lives and when these are gone, the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: A stack of A's are blocking my path

title: Combat Flight

description: CroZXy Road is a retro remake of the mobile game Crossy Road made with permission of the original developers Hipster Whale. Like the game it's based on, it is a variant of Frogger that is viewed from an isometric perspective. The game is endless and the player's goal is simply to make it as far as possible without dying. To do so it's necessary to cross roads, rivers and rail tracks without being hit by a vehicle or drowning. For every step taken forward the player's score increases by one. The screen automatically scrolls forward and the player has to keep moving or disappear from the screen. Leaving the playing area in any direction will result in death.
title: CroZXy Road

description: High Resolution Invaders is a Space Invaders variant that was one of the first games to use high resolution graphics on an unmodified 16K ZX81. The gameplay works just like in the original with the player moving left and right while shooting at the aliens that move back and forth across the screen. The aliens drop bombs that have to be avoided and four shields offer some protection. The aliens differ from the arcade game in that they only move horizontally but never descend. The player has three lives and the game ends when they have been used up. Before starting out it's possible to choose the firing rate for the player's missiles as well as for the aliens bombs, from one to six. The game can be played by one player, two players taking turns or two players playing simultaneously.
title: High Resolution Invaders

description:
Game-Pac is a compilation of two games and a dice rolling program.

  • Greed is a dice game played against an AI opponent. The objective is to get the highest score by rolling two dice and adding the result of each roll. The game is played in ten rounds and when the player chooses to stop the score is added to the one of previous rounds. Rolling the starting value a second time leads to a crap out and all points of the round will be lost.

  • Brain Teaser is a puzzle game similar to the board game Lights Out. The player is presented with the numbers 1 to 9 shown on a 3 by 3 grid. Numbers are either normal or inverse and the goal is to get an inverse 5 and all others as normal. The player can choose to flip any number but then also all adjacent numbers will be flipped.

  • Super Dice is a program that simulates dice rolls. The player can roll up to five six-sided dice or one four-, eight-, ten-, twelve- or twenty-sided die.
title: Game-Pac

description:
The Nowotnik Puzzle & Other Diversions is a compilation of three games:

  • Nowotnik Puzzle is a sliding block puzzle game where the player has to recreate the original image of four large squares after they have been shuffled around. The game was later released on its own for ZX Spectrum and Oric computers.

  • Demolition is a simple action game where the objective is to destroy as many bricks as possible. Walls of bricks grow from the bottom and have to be destroyed by firing asterisks before they reach the top of the screen.

  • Ten Pin Bowling is a bowling game for one or two players played from a top down perspective. Firing the ball is done simply by pressing a number between one and nine to indicate the strength.
title: The Nowotnik Puzzle & Other Diversions

description: Uwol is a conversion of the original Uwol: Quest for Money first released in 2009. This release for the ZX81 is identical in concept and gameplay, but because of the screen size restrictions the original levels could not be used. Instead all levels are entirely new for this edition and 2D scrolling is used instead of the fixed-screen levels of the original version. Also five lives are provided at the start instead of three.
title: Uwol

description: Nanako in Classic Japanese Monster Castle is based on the 2007 game Nanako in Classic Japanese Monster Castle. This release for the ZX81 is identical in concept and gameplay, but because of the screen size restrictions the original levels could not be used. Instead all levels are entirely new for this edition and 2D scrolling is used instead of the fixed-screen levels of the original version. Instead of 25 levels there are now 30 in total and they are all different. After completing a room a password is provided to continue from that point the next time and all passwords are also different for this version.
title: Nanako in Classic Japanese Monster Castle

description:
Super Refried Gun Operation '81 is a take on the mechanics of games like Operation Wolf set in the developer's Uwol universe. The game is set in FuenteTortillo del Alcornocal, province of Badajoz, which has become increasingly unsafe as the streets are now full of Roboces (clones of Fanty, Wolfy, Vampy and Franky created by the evil Dr. Brain) who steal money from the citizens. Uwol steps in to take care of the problem.

Uwol is not controlled directly, instead the player controls a set of cross-hairs that can be moved freely on the screen similar to a gallery shooter. An automatic shotgun is used to shoot. Enemies shoot back and the player has to watch out not to kill anyone innocent such as Uwol on the screen. To finish a level a number of coins need to be collected, left behind by defeated enemies. The require amount needs to be collected before time runs out as well.
title: Super Refried Gun Operation '81

description: Deflex is a Deflection clone with a twist. Instead of static mirrors, the deflectors or bats flip as they are hit by the ball. You place deflectors in the location the ball is at the time of placement and the ball immediately changes direction. The aim is to hit a target in the least amount of time.
title: Deflex

description: Othello Reversi is a computer conversion of the popular two players board game Reversi, also known as Othello. The aim is to fill the board with as many bricks of your own color as possible. On each turn the player places a disc on the 8x8 grid by selecting a location where the opponents discs will become trapped between two of his discs. The enclosed discs are flipped over to the players color. The game ends when there are no empty tiles left. The player with the most discs on board wins the game.
title: Othello  Reversi

description:
Fly Low Hit Hard is a homebrew, side-scrolling shoot'em up where the player steers a small spacecraft and has to destroy or avoid spaceships and buildings (these look like "X"s), with the spaceships being destroyed pixel by pixel.

The game also features SAMs (surface-to-air missiles) that launch and will explode if they hit the player's spacecraft. However, SAMs can also be destroyed.

The player starts with five lives and gets a new life for every additional 100 points.
title: Fly Low Hit Hard

description:
In charge of the last remaining starship, the Enterprise, it is your mission to save the federation from the aliens who are invading the galaxy.

This is a variant of Star Trek for the ZX81.
title: Startrek
